description:
You know, when you're in the mood for no fuss, quick, hits the spot Hawaii plate lunch/bbq --this is your go to spot ( if you're in the outer sunset). Portions are always generous and I've never been disappointed in their bbq chicken which is flavorful and juicy. The BF always order their chicken kayaks which fulfills his friend chicken cravings. I love that they're willing to sub the standard plate lunch sides ( Mac salad and rice) for all veggies ( cabbage). They also have a nice salad option if you're t unit to watch your carb intake ( not that you would go to get Hawaiian bbq and worry about carbs). For me, I realize a mini plate is plenty of food and can satisfied a hungry month. If you're starving  he regular plate is more than enough with left overs a guarantee. 

Pro tip: place a phone order! It'll be faster.
author: Diane T.

description:
Like any other Ono out there, it does the job. You want generic Hawaiian BBQ then you go here. The line can sometimes get long but the wait is usually manageable.

So BBQ beef, chicken, short ribs, or chicken katsu are the main attractions here. So order something with that or a combination of all of that. The plates come with 2 scoops of rice, macaroni salad, and some veggies; alternatively, you can request all rice and everything becomes rice instead. Don't forget the teriyaki sauce and katsu sauce on the side!

Ono's works, it's nothing spectacular but it's reliable.
author: Derek T.

description: Having a Birthday Celebration with few friends coming and got no time to Prepare...I ordered the Ono Family Meal...3 choice but Its a must to have a Kailua Pork, BBQ Beef and Chicken Katsu...they also have a side of Macaroni and Rice...Problem Solve ..My Friends Loved it..It saved me time ...Simply Called them Ordered it...within 15mins their ready...Took me 25mins to drive from my place to this place..worth it...prepared well..nothing spilled...Overall...This is a good Choice for a Quick Party Celebration Plan...Id recommend the Kailua Pork and the BBQ Beef...
author: Donovan L.

description:
Bad service. Ordered a family platter for my birthday party and asked to change fire chicken to pork. Dark haired female cashier said no without asking the kitchen if it was ok or not. We continue waiting and the last thing that was cooked was the fire chicken. 
Needs work on customer service. At least make it seem like you care!
author: Alaiyo A.

description:
I am a meat lover so I always order the Hawaiian BBQ mix (BBQ beef, chicken and kalbi) or BBQ and Katsu Mix (BBQ beef, BBQ chicken and chicken katsu) which comes with plenty of rice, delicious macaroni salad and cabbage. I usually don't eat the cabbage, because they put the meat on top of it and the cabbage gets all oily. The portions are huge and the meat is tender and juicy, not dry at all. Don't forget the sauce that goes with the meat. Be careful when pumping out the katsu sauce because it once burned my hand since it was so hot. Another time it wasn't even warm, basically too cold for my enjoyment. 

The wait time can be at least 10 minutes long, depending on how many orders are ahead of you. I see people call ahead for pick up, so that's a good idea if you don't want to wait for your order. 

There are coupons for this place that I get in the mail, so maybe you can find a good deal in your mail too!
author: Donna M.

description:
When ever I'm craving ribs or macaroni salad, I love cvoming here. The sauce bar is nice too. But there are times where i feel like they are skimping on the sides.

The meat are tender and juicy. There have been times where I feel like the employees are rude and don't really acknowledge you. Which is such a big let down.
author: Bonnie C.

description:
Ordered a Katsu chicken plate lunch to go. This is Just the right amount of food for my husband and I. It came with two scoops of white rice, one scoop of Mac salad and some cabbage and broccoli. Make sure you fill two containers each of the katsu sauce and teriyaki sauce. I pour The teriyaki sauce over my white rice. It is delicious. The Katsu chicken was crispy. It was hot and we didn't even have to wait. 

Perfect fast meal for two for under $11.
author: Donna L.

description:
The roommate wanted Mexican or Hawaiian food the day before. Since we fulfilled the Mexican craving, we decided to order Hawaiian barbecue. It was a holiday, so our normal place wasn't open. Decided to try Ono Hawaiian BBQ since they were on Postmates. We placed our dinner delivery order on Monday, May 29th at 6:45pm. It arrived at 7:44pm. We live in Outer Richmond.

*Kalua Pork With Cabbage: Slow roasted pork with a hint of smokey flavor, served shredded over steamed cabbage, Includes 2 scoops of rice, 1 scoop of our famous macaroni salad and vegetables ($8.79)
*Hawaiian Bbq Mix: Bbq chicken, bbq beef & kalbi short ribs, Includes 2 scoops of rice, 1 scoop of our famous macaroni salad and vegetables ($9.79)
*Chicken Katsu: Curry, Includes rice and macaroni salad ($6.59)
*Macaroni Salad: 4 scoops ($5.69)

I got the bbq mixed plate. It was a good portion with one slice of kalbi and a good amount of chicken and beef. All the meats had a nice smokiness to them. I also ordered the chicken katsu to share. This was not very good. Chewy, hard, and dry. Not much chicken either. The curry didn't help much as it was really thin and didn't coat the katsu. The roommate got the kalua pork which he seemed to enjoy. We both like macaroni salad, so he got a huge side of it. One disappointing thing, we ordered Spam Musubi (2pcs): A block of rice topped with a dash of teriyaki sauce and a slice of spam, wrapped in seaweed ($3.99), but never received it. Not sure if Postmates forgot to order it or Ono forgot to pack it, but we did get a refund on that item. Such a bummer cuz I love spam musubi when having Hawaiian food!

Decent replacement for my usual go to Hawaiian spot. I'd just avoid the chicken katsu. If I ever order from them again, hopefully my spam musubi won't be forgotten!
author: Elena N.

description:
Few dining options in this little plaza: Subway, a Thai noodle place, an "okay sushi spot" (I was told) and Ono Hawaiian. 

Some unhealthy things on the menu including SPAM and deep fried chicken and fish but also more healthful offerings like lemon pepper chicken and plain grilled chicken.

They also have mini meals which offer smaller portions - so if you want to indulge, you can do it with a better portioned meal.

I hadn't eaten breakfast or lunch so I chose the grilled BBQ chicken which was pretty good but was a heaping, massive amount of protein and white rice. The mini meals are definitely the way to go.

The scoop of macaroni salad I was prepared to scoff at was really good- really really good! 

Wait time was about 10 minutes; they cook to order. 

Communal tables, very clean space (food inspection score 93), this Hawaiian eatery is an okay choice for under $10 a meal.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
After a few trips here I had to bump up my review rating. The place has really stepped their game up. I love their bbq chicken (#1) and my family and friends have had the #4 and #44 and love it as well. All great high carb cheat meals. 

The macaroni is delicious. I love the cabbage and veggies they add in. They're always cooked perfect. 

The drinks they have are a bit overpriced but they are unique and fitting for the establishment. For a chain-restaurant they really aren't bad. They offer catering and they also have clearly displayed nutrition info which is helpful for those who have dietary concerns or perimeters they have to work within. 

The service is great and always very fast. Never more than a 5min wait and food always tastes fresh so I imagine they are busy busy busy. I'll be back on occasion for a cheat meal or maybe even just for catering for a small party.
author: Bella B.

description:
Dropped by here after quite a while.  Looks like they remodeled the place.  The service was fine but the food was not.  I ordered the chicken combo plate and got burned chicken.  I'll post pics.  How can food that is clearly burned leave the kitchen?  You can smell the burnt food and see that its had black parts.

Bad cooks!
author: Guest U.

description:
Sadly an ono experience. Food is not bad. Service is not bad. 

Why the three stars? i unfortunately found two pieces of tiny hair in my rice. Is there a dog running around in the back while they wash their rice? Haha not a huge deal but they really need to be careful...at least i didnt find a cockroach in my dish, lol...
i would go back again...had i not seen the 2 pieces of hair in my rice. :(
author: Pamela P.

description: Go here if you have to.  It tastes ok.  Portion size of meats is small compared to some competitors.  I got orders to go be side I in a rush.  No katsu sauce was provided.  For people getting things to go, we shouldn't have to go ask for it or get the sauce ourselves if it is self service sauce.
author: Herman L.

description:
The girls working the cashier need to learn a thing two about service.  I ordered an island curry chicken plate.  What came out was a BBQ chicken plate topped with three small curry potatoes and a carrot.  I asked the girls for a small cup of curry sauce...you know, so I can actually have curry on my chicken!!?  

She replied that she'll need to charge me for the extra.  I then showed her my food and reiterated...you guys just gave me BBQ chicken with curry toppings.  "Maybe the sauce soaked to the bottom?" She retorted.  

Look, I paid for something, you guys went stingy on me...I'm not paying extra for something that I should've gotten.  It's just a scoop of curry sauce, is it really a loss to the company?  I know one thing you've lost...my future business.
author: Kris M.

description:
Anywhere with EZ parking is always a plus for me :) ( esp in sf D: )

I ordered the mini chicken katsu meal for 6.99 and it was the perfect size for me! (check pics for sizes :p ) Chicken katsu was plentiful in the mini meal and it was delicious! The katsu + teriyaki sauce were on the side for us to grab :). I also added a small fountain drink (unlim refills) for ~$2, so the total was around ~$10. (which is the price of a regular dish) TOTALLY worth it, if you're someone with a medium-ish appetite. 

My bf ordered #5 for about ~$9. He replaced the bbq chicken for chicken katsu and the plater came with fried shrimp and fried fish fillet. The shrimp was my favorite part of his plate. (there is also tarter sauce packets on the side as well)

I really liked the food and overall this place is pretty awesome!
author: Melanie T.

description:
Rice in spam Musubi hard!  Not fully cooked.  Had three orders n all the same!

Will try again hope it is better !
author: Alberta C.

description: Did Onos suddenly change their teriyaki sauce for spam musubis?  I picked up an order last Saturday and the teriyaki sauce tasted very strange. It was kind of sour and not sweet and salty like any other teriyaki sauce I've ever used. I'm not sure if I could go back knowing that I didn't even enjoy the spam musubis which is the only thing I order.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
I'm not sure why I love Ono so much! Maybe because it brings my memories. I've been eating Ono since my good ol' high school days and it was one my favorite fast food chains growing up.

Their Mac salad is hands down my favorite Mac salad of all time and it is especially yummy drizzled in teriyaki sauce. 

I haven't been to this location in a while and I'm really liking their new interior and modern lights.
author: Frances K.

description: I waited for my food for over 30 minutes! When I checked in with the cashier, she said 3-4 minutes. She even had eye contact with me. When I went up again, the other cashier said that it has been ready for me. I'm infuriated at the service here! I didn't even get to eat my lunch back at work since my lunch break was over. DO NOT GO HERE!
author: Reginald V.

description: I love their food! Some of the best tasting food in California. Period! Every time we want to go get something quick and delicious, this is the our go-to spot. Definitely recommend this place.
author: Brenda G.

description: Food is good but the service from the _____ sucks. I like the girl who takes the order she a hard worker strong accent but she good people.  If it wasn't for the food I wouldn't come back. Need a combo number for Bbq beef and chicken  katsu.  I don't need attitude from the cook if the order need to be fixed.
author: Kev B.

description: A good place for a quick stop for some tasty food. I really like their Korean style short rib and bbq chicken.
author: Angie A.

description:
Bad quality, cheap oily, bland seafood, cashier with bad attitude.
Need to improve seasoning...
author: Jose A.

description: Ono Hawaiian BBQ has become one of my favorite fast food restaurants because of the amazing menu they have and because I can get my food without a wait. One of my favorite things to get there is the macaroni. I also like the cabbage and veggies they add in with the order. It is absolutely delicious and mouth-watering. If I'm not having chicken then I'm definitely feasting the smokey slow roasted pork. The food from here is absolutely delicious and everything is fresh. I adore the effort that they put into this place and I will keep coming back for more!
author: Jennifer E.

description:
bruh. this place is effin fire.  this place is so lit it beats sit-down restaurants, the chicken katsu here is better than alot of like nice japanese places i've been too

i never even liked mac salad, from places like l&l or other hawaiian bbq places until i've had the ono mac salad.  

ya'll are doing a mighty fine job , please keep this level of quality. 

#44 bbq mix combo w/ 1 order of spam misubis every damn time its lit. 

all caps because the aloha salad dressing is so good.
author: Justin C.

description:
I frequent this location once every couple of months. 

My go-to is the BBQ Chicken Plate. My boyfriend and I share it every time. For us, it is enough food for two and sometimes we even have left overs. My chicken is always cooked well, never overdone and always similar portions to the previous visit. The rice is decent. I often skip the cabbage and request more rice as I don't like how soggy the greens become. I personally don't like macaroni salad, but J loves that stuff! 

Sometimes, I venture out to try different offerings, the Kalua pork is pretty decent but a little salty. I am not a fan of the beef. But I do like the fish, it is similar to a frozen fish stick, but always perfectly cooked and never dry. The shrimp is also always good. 

J loved the Spam Masubi. 

They completely re-did the inside of the location and it looks fantastic!
author: Meghan L.

description:
It is Ono. Just a place to get something simple on a lunch break.

This place tends to be occupied by the teens which may be enough to give you some perspective on who tends to frequent here.

The menu probably what you would imagine. They have some spam, BBQ, katsu, rice, and a few other odd dishes on their menu. Most of the items come in a meal. I like to go with the chicken and katsu combo. It will fill you up for sure. Not eat from here too often because you will put on the POUNDS!!! 

The seating outside is nice because you can breath! This place can get packed during lunch time which can lead to leaning and standing in difficult positions inside. You can at least stretch your legs outside. 

That is it. There is nothing else that really needs to be said. Oh, if you want to hear strange and absurd conversation come here when the high school kids come stop by. You wont need to ease drop because most of them talk so loud. 

Enjoy your lunch!!!
author: Robert F.

description:
Good stuff. makes me happy. one lunch plate is plenty of meat and rice and mac salad. Sit outside if inside it too crowded. 
Catering options available!
You'll have to wait a while for the food to be made though, because they cook it fresh.
author: Veranna N.

description: Definitely one of my favorite chains of Hawaiian restaurants. They make food fairly fast and have a large menu. My favorite is the BBQ mix plate or short ribs. They have hot teriyaki and katsu available at the small condiment bar. Limited indoor seating, but enough for a small group during certain hours.great place to go during or after shopping at the strip mall here. Also has seating outside. They don't complain if I smoke out there.
author: Alex C.

description:
Pretty decent Hawaiian restaurant. Used to come here a lot during my high school days.

Their chicken katsu was my favorite item to get: the quality of the chicken is decent, nothing remarkable, but it was pretty tasty and very filling. I also tried their pork short ribs and their beef plates, but didn't find either of them particular good (quite fatty for my preference). Meals are usually served with rice and a side of macaroni. Didn't find their rice that appetizing, but their macaroni is pretty decent (though a bit heavy).
author: Alvin W.

description:
Is it my imagination or have things at this Ono's location gone from a high of "meh" to complete crap? I picked up some takeout this evening and used a BOGO coupon that requires you to buy two diabetes-inducing, novelly large drinks to go with it. In the past, I've been allowed to swap the large sodas with two canned juices, but the incompetent cashier refused to allow me to despite the large drinks being more expensive and telling her I'm happy to pay for them and take the cheaper product. She failed to explain how that made sense, instead choosing to stare at me like a deer in the headlights, and it was clear that this was fast becoming a Mexican standoff so I decided it wasn't worth it and walked away from the confrontation.

Smash-cut to arriving at home 5 minutes after leaving Ono's and when I dig into my plate, I disappointingly found the chicken katsu to be old, cold, dried out, and had he texture of beef jerky. The rice itself was somehow cold too, as was my girlfriends chicken curry. It was clear that the food had been sitting under a heat lamp for quite some time and needed to be trashed, not served.

For some reason the service at this location is ALWAYS horrible no matter who is behind the counter (as observed by other Yelpers). They're hyper stingy, have a bad attitude, and it's definitely not worth spending your hard earned money there. It's got the same owners as the Numi Yogurt in the same plaza, itself having some of the worlds worst customer service. Never...again.
author: Joe M.

description:
I came here to order some musubi. I wasn't sure how to order it, and when the cashier rung me up, it was double the price it was supposed to be. When I asked why, she said I had four orders when I intended on only two. She started giving me attitude over and "tried" explaining it to me, when in reality she just came off very condescending and kept putting the blame on me. 
On top of that, I'm pretty sure she told the chefs to burn the food because when I opened the musubi up, the spam was burnt and rubbery.
author: Kristina L.

description: Went there today to get the barbecue beef for lunch. 30% of the beef was small/mince particles...ideal for people without teeth. I have teeth and I like to chew on my food.
author: Steven J.

description:
The good is good 
But I always feel guilty eating it since it's mostly meat 
Need some health alternative 
Spam musubi is good
author: Emily C.

description: Tried to use a gift card today that was given with purchase last October.  They told me that I couldn't use it because the card expired at the end of December.  They never told people that there was an expiration date.  Just lost me as a customer!!! I tthink that I will stick with L & L from now on!
author: Katie T.

description:
When considering
how often I frequent this place
and how I was its duke for a shining millisecond,
how could I possibly give Ono anything less than three stars?

It'd be saying that
I knowingly frequent a bad eatery
and that just sounds terrible
and wouldn't be true.

So I've given Ono an additional star
for being a reliable spot
when in search of quick
Hawaiian grub.

The food doesn't consistently
wow me
but it's close by and every once in a while
chicken katsu isn't half bad.
author: Dan B.

description: Nice quick fix for Hawaiian food. The teriyaki meats and chicken katsu are very tasty. The portion they give you is quite a lot, so you do get your money's worth.
author: David S.

description:
Always my goto hawaiian BBQ place. Been coming here since they first opened and I have to admit, while their prices have been steadily going up, their portion sizes have been going down...which is disappointing but I keep coming cause it's convenient.

I would have to say the best part about Ono is their macaroni salad. I almost always get their chicken katsu but occasionally I would get beef (if im feelin adventurous). But if you're in the area and craving hawaiian bbq, why not? 

It's not the best, but definitely not the worst!
author: Carrie L.

description: Food is ok I guess if you have no idea what you want to eat portions are okay for their price but service suck. Staff are rude.
author: Michele T.

description:
I give this place 4 out of 5 stars for a a number of reasons.
1) it's not super expensive, especially considering how much food you get. 
2) haven't experienced a whole lot of waiting time, including in person ordering and phone orders.
3) the staff is nice, not super personable or super knowledgeable on the food. (Downside )
4) not a ton of seating, usually one or two spots available to sit and eat (I usually order to go)
5) I've never had them mess up my food out of 15 orders or so. 
Overall, food tastes good, the price is right, you won't be disappointed.
author: Andrew S.

description:
We were over at friends' for July 4th celebration/BBQ.  They ordered food from this Ono's as part of the food choices.  Huge aluminum trays of chicken katsu - panko battered and good; thin slices of rib - more fat and bone than meat but good marinated flavor; macaroni salad - much better now than before and I enjoyed it a lot; rice. 
I'm certain our friends spent a lot of money on the food given what you get.  At least they do trays for your parties but they do not deliver and you have to pick up.  

Not many other places you can order Hawaiian-type food from in SF besides this chain or L&L in Daly City so you're stuck paying higher prices.
author: Ry T.

description: So bomb! Definitely try if your in the area you get a lot of food for you money and its good quality. It doesn't taste greasy or cheap. Always fills me up for around 10-13 dollars and I eat a lot!
author: Adam L.

description: Definitely my go to hearty meal. HUGE PORTIONS. Be prepared for a food comma afterwards.  I recommend sticking to their chicken items. Their short ribs are a joke. All fat and chewy. Also recommend calling in your order before, even if your dinning there. They take a little longer that most "fast food" type restaurants.
author: Jenelle A.

description: Although I know Ono is not the AUTHENTIC lovely islander food, i honestly still like the food here. However, it can be dry sometimes but I always go for the Spam Masubi or Shrimp Platter!
author: Stacey M.

description:
I said I was going to try something else from the menu. It was already a little past 1 pm when I came in here to get something for lunch. I ordered a Chicken Katsu plate with Steamed Rice and Macaroni Salad plus a Mango Orange Nectar.*
*The canned beverages are Hawaiian Sun branded!*

I am craving for another plate of Steamed Rice and Chicken Katsu with Macaroni Salad as I write this update.

The staff members working here are friendly but the customers aren't really friendly.

08/08/2014:
- Spam Musubi (2 pieces)
- Hawaiian Sun Pineapple Orange Nectar
Spam Musubi with a Pineapple Orange Nectar is absolutely delicious and refreshing.
author: Bennett W.

description:
Perhaps I'm not totally impartial.  

We lived in Honolulu for over a year many years ago, and the one thing I truly miss is the plate lunches (and yeah, the never-ending beaches, the trade winds blowing gently onto your lanai, the crazy unbelievable sunsets...)

But Ono Hawaiian BBQ approximates what we used to salivate over in HI, pretty much spot-on.  Even more than L and L Hawaiian BBQ, which is an import from HI. 

Ono's plates lunch are delicious and one positive is that there is more volume to their veggies than other Hawaiian style plate lunches -- even the ones actually in Hawaii.  Their meat offerings are generally be served on steamed cabbage. Mmm..

Given that any truly authentic plate lunch is a carb-centric, forget-your-diet-what-duet, calorie bomb fest, I appreciate that the cabbage is in there.  

I usually steam a bunch of other veggies with anything I order anyway -- when we take out for home consumption. 

And their mac salad is truly ono!

I highly, highly recommend! The BBQ chicken, chicken Katsu ( deep fry) and BBQ Kalbi beef are our faves :)
author: Hot Lunch Lad Y.

description:
I have no idea why there would be people complaining about the food here. I have been several times, and being that I lived in Hawaii for 4 years, trust me when I say that the food here is legit! The Hawaiian BBQ chicken is my fav, but I also enjoy the Kalua pork... Brings me back to the island every time I eat it.  

The only thing I will say is that it would be nice to get a drink with the pick two option.

If you are looking for healthy food, Hawaiian isn't the way to go... It's packed with carbs and protein, but the flavor is great... I'm never disappointed.
author: Jackie O.

description:
Came to get a quick dinner. Nothing special but gets the job done. I ordered the bbq chicken and beef musubi with a side of macaroni salad and the bf ordered the chicken katsu to go. The macaroni salad was the best part.

Update update update! Just got home and realized they forgot to put our order of musubis in the bag. Wish I could give 0 stars just because I don't want to drive back to get it and I'll have to rummage through my fridge for food! NOT HAPPYYYYYY!!!

Update again! There's fucking hair in the food they did give us! Disgustinggggg
author: Michelle H.

description:
Somewhat remodeled the seating area and guess what. Raised the prices and limited the portions.
I'd still probably come but not as often.
author: Larry L.

description: I don't understand why people rate Ono so poorly. It's basically Hawaiian fast food, so it's obviously not going to be the most amazing thing in the world. The food comes out quick, it tastes fine, and it's reasonably priced. The mini meals are a great size. They give you plenty of food. I like the Katsu.
author: Jeffrey L.

description: this is the worse Hawaiian BBQ I had so far. I ordered entree of chicken katsu and kolua pork. The chicken is pretty small and disgusting uncooked w/bad smell. Their kolua pork is nothing like Koloa. it's full of uncooked cabbage without sauce and porn is not mixed. I wasted my money frm full of rice and cabbage. I literally got mad af because of the taste of chicken so raw and nasty
author: Chris C.

description:
Somewhat authentic Hawaiian food in the sense that the food is... cooked. 

The mini meals are huge, but for around $2 more, you get 1.5x more! This is my "I'm really not in the mood to cook right now" food, and it serves the purpose of keeping me from starving.

The service is fine, but the wait time for the food is always much longer than I expect for something that is supposed to be fast food. Food is hot, katsu is always crispy, and the macaroni salad tastes only like mayonnaise. 

+Parking in the immediate absolutely sucks - cramped, crowded, ugh.
author: Colleen M.

description:
CLOSED for remodel until January 22,
Sad I couldn't get my katsu chicken, but Once they reopen, I'd highly suggest this place! Great good.
author: Alex G.

description:
My last visit prior to this evening was a couple of months ago. At that time I was greeted by a young man as I approached the counter. Greeted is the wrong word, he looked at me and said nothing. No, "Hello". 
No, "Can I help you? No, "What can I get for you?"  Nothing. So I just got on with it, and told him what I wanted. 
     This evening was not much different. I did get a mumbled "Hi", but nothing else. I don't blame the staff for this obvious lack of customer service. It's not their fault if they are not trained. Maybe they have all of the customers they can handle, and don't need any more
business, or maybe management doesn't know any better either. 
     A word about the food.  It was very good.
     I'm not interested in these people becoming my friends. That's not the point. Common courtesy dictates that you should be greeted, asked what you want, and then is this too much to ask -we are thanked on the way out.  Without this courtesy let alone an "Is there any thing else I can get for you? ", the staff at the front counter will ultimately be replaced by a screen and buttons.
author: Philip A.

description: Just got my order of chicken Katsu and the price continues to rise but portion continue to get smaller. Very disappointed with this restaurant.  I may double think whether to come back again..
author: Mimi W.

description:
The food here is good. The chicken, shrimp and beef all are cooked fresh and not just sitting there to be reheated. Order a combo plate, shorts ribs or Katsu and you'll be happy and full. They give you some good sized portions. Only down side is that sometimes the service can be subpar.

Im not really a good photo taker but this plate was good so after the first bite I took a photo.

TIP, Call ahead and order first. The wait can sometimes be a pain especially when you got a bunch of people waiting in a small area.
author: T C.

description: Pretty good food.   I don't know why people complain about this joint.     I love the sea food combo       spam musubi is pretty good too
author: Shawn J.

description: They're always busy from school kids around trying to order lunch with also just about everyone. The team always putting out awesome food with amazing portions size. Customer service is typical, they might be slow at times due to the high or few cooks that haven't come in for work . Be mindful and not a ahole! Been 6 years I've ate here still my post workout spot!
author: Alan S.

description: Good spot- reliable, nothing too special. Chicken Katsu, the 'spicy' chicken, and the teriyaki are all regulars for us.   The items are filling, with kid friendly small-size/price items available, and tasty enough.  Reasonable prices for the whole family.  I'll be back for sure.
author: Andy S.

description:
Hawaiian isn't usually my deal, so I'm going really easy on this one. All the meat was pretty fatty, for example, but I think that's partly a taste thing, so no stars off for that. Overall it's pretty simple, salty-sweet food, but that's also a taste thing.

On the plus side, their spam musubi are decent, inexpensive and large. The kalua pork was pretty good as well. Overall the prices are reasonable for San Francisco. The salad wasn't bad.

On the negative: the crab rangoon were basically just a bunch of cream cheese. The teriyaki was meh.

Overall it wasn't an experience worth repeating in a city with this much good food.
author: Nathan P.

description:
Don't try and order an egg a specific way. 

Sunny side up
Over easy
And scrambled are foreign terms in this cooking spot

Tried to explain the best I could to not flip the egg over when it's cooking cause the person I ordered from looked at me like I was stupid when I asked for spam and egg all rice no cabbage.

I got over easy eggs rice AND macaroni salad. Why does l&l have this basic dish down. If there's another Hawaiian food place  near you avoid this one. Id be surprised  if people are good handle qualified here. She cleaned the garbage then went back to the register and handed me my food.

I'll survive but health code says that's a no no
author: Mitchell M.

description: Okay, let me start by saying that I really hate giving 1 star reviews, but this place saved me a special seat on the porcelain throne! After studying for midterms, my parents were super nice and brought my sister and I food from Ono Hawaiian BBQ. My sister got a chicken katsu while I got a BBQ short rib plate and we both got spam musubi. Honestly, L&L is better than Ono, but that's besides the point because a couple of hours later, I woke up from my deep sleep and had massive diarrhea! White Chicks bathroom scene all over again, man. Don't go here!
author: Joyce E.

description:
I ordered the seafood mix which has fish, shrimp, and some BBQ chicken.
For $10, it seems like a good value for that you get.  Until I got home and opened the box, to find that there's HAIR that sticks to the BBQ chicken!! Completely unacceptable!!!
author: Stephanie W.

description: Went to several diff Hawaiian places. This is the best so far. Location is great because it's in a plaza with lots of parking spaces.
author: amanda t.

description:
Food here is great. But the staff is awful!!
Came in and ordered a family meal, when I came the place was empty, they told me 10 minutes. I waited 20 minutes and still no food, people with order #'s later than mine were getting their food. I was #197 and they were serving 205, I went up there and asked the girl and she almost yelled at me "JUST WAIT THEIR MAKING IT" I told her I was told 10 minutes and it's been 20 and people after me have been served she said "it's busy so you have to wait" I told her I came in before it was busy when I came in the place was empty. She turned around and looked at the kitchen and then said "JUST WAIT" 
I finally got my food after 30 minutes. And they were on #220. I was #197 and just got my food. Then I had to argue with the rude lady to give me the bag that I already paid for. 
Food was great. Service is crap.
author: Tatyana S.

description:
Awesome place for 10 dollar take out.   Num 44. Cant go wrong.   :-)

I thought 44 was just for willie Mac and Hank, not so, it is this place too!
author: Robert J.

description:
This place used to be my go to spot whenever I felt like getting some Hawaiian bbq since it was pretty close by and had parking available. I used to come here alot when they first opened since I had a couple friends who worked here as well. The quantities are pretty generous and they usually send out coupons with the weekly newspapers.

I revisited this place recently and the bbq chicken was pretty burnt. No, I don't like cancer so this sucked big time. I spent a lot of time cutting off the burnt parts and hate complaining when it comes to food until after I finish cause I've heard of chefs messing with people's food once they hear about the complaint. Maybe it was just the chef they had that day but it was still a waste of time.
author: Ced C.

description:
Really disappointed. Ordered the curry chicken plate and requested that there be actual curry sauce with it. Was told by server Sarah He that she will make sure there was sauce. It was even to come with a mixed salad and not Mac Salad... FAIL!!! What I received was a BBQ Chicken plate with mac salad... LAME!!!

Not sure how much more she could care less of her service.
author: robert C.

description: Boyfriend was craving Hawaiian so stopped by here on my way home from work to pick up dinner. Ordered 2 things chicken combo plate and crispy shrimp plate. After waiting awhile finally got my order and headed home. The weather was pretty bad, rainy and windy and very wet, and after a long day at work I wanted nothing more than to get home and get dinner over with and to just relax. After getting home, the BF opens up the box to find that they gave us the wrong thing got the seafood mix plate, he was pretty upset and didn't want to drive back. After getting into a heated argument over not checking the receipt, and not getting the right item, we both lost our appetite and the night was ruined. I don't understand how they got crispy shrimp mixed up with seafood mix. I've never ordered that before and we are habitual about what we get at certain places. Not only did I get the wrong order but the seafood mix was more expensive and went to waste. So basically paid for food we didn't want and ended up having a horrible night.
author: Lily S.

description: Today I wen there for my lunch break and I told them I need sea food combo and need it to be well done and I told them three times just to make sure and the lady in the front say yes don't worry I will make sure to have your meal well done then I wen back and check the lunch and it was not even well done or not even cool right it is kind a row meet wow shame on you guys what a wast of my time and my money learn how to tell people true don't lie and do some other thinks
author: Claude C.

description: Ordered chicken katsu, seafood platter, and the mixed BBQ plate. My only issue is with my BBQ plate, not enough ribs . Only one rib in the plate is a no go for me. Everything else is fine, but it would be nice to load up on the meat! The other orders were also OK. The mac salad is the best!
author: Dirk D.

description:
I don like to write negative reviews. But I have to do it.
I have been here a few times and the food is actually OK (BBQ fast food) 
But the customer service is terrible.( the worst really)
So very unpleasent I will never comeback to this location because they make you feel unwelcome 

Sorry Ono Hawaiian BBQ at Sloat. But I am very disappointed.
author: Julio L.

description:
Y UNO like ONO? haha get it?!?!

I've been to a hand full of hawaiian BBQ places in the bay area and they all taste the same. They all offer the same menu and they serve it all at the same style and price. I do enjoy eating the food - you get a huge amount of food for the money. 

If you are enjoy commercialized hawaiian bbq and this place was the closest one to you then go to that one since they are all the same.
author: Ryan R.

description:
We had a coupon for $5 dollars off $20. It isn't super delicious but they give you a ton of food! 

$20 dollars got us each a main entree, two scoops of rice, and a scoop of macaroni salad. We also had the chicken masubis. There was two pieces and each one had a whole chicken breast on top of the rectangle of rice. They gave us a ton of meat. We had leftovers for 3 meals! 

A lot of college students go here and now I know why haha. You totally get stuffed at this place for cheap.
author: Allen C.

description: 30 minutes for a simple Kalua Pork order? This is insane. Inside is very dirty and staff is rude when asked about a long wait. Not greeting or thanking clients as well. I say the management should me more involved in the business.
author: Aleksey G.

description:
No nonsense Hawaiian BBQ. Get the family meal if you have a group of 4 or 5; you get to pick 3 meats and it comes with 6 scoops of rice and a giant portion of mac salad. Way enough!! Everything is good here and I find the BBQ flavors to be not overpoweringly sweet. Always a plus. 

Workers could use better attitude though. Sheesh, sorry we missed picking up our orders by 5 min. No need for the stink eye...
author: Sally C.

description:
that's about as high as I can go for a quasi fast food place. and since this is the only fast food place I'll eat I do really like it. the "meals" are consistent. really I only come here for my spam musubi fix. great for a quick meal. small spot so you may or May not get a table. to go orders are easy and parking is easy usually too. hey buses stop right in front of the shopping center. 

aloha spamaholics
author: Nena L.

description: Ordered take out from Lakeshore Plaza location. Tasted okay when I got home. Very similar to L&L chain. #44 bbq chicken, bbq beef, and chicken Katsu.. With Mac and rice. I thought this was better than some of the other fast food eateries in this mall. Free parking in this small mall probably due to Lucky super here and all the other shops/businesses here.
author: Clifford W.

description:
Either the employees are illiterate or just don't know what customer service is. I ordered food and had waited 10 min, I returned to the register and hey said my number was already called. I never picked up any food, they did NOT read the number when the customer before me picked it up. They continued to say that I had picked up my good when I obviously have not. After 10 mins of arguing with the employee they decided to make another order of my food. 

Once I got my good it was not even what I had ordered.

Idk if I'll be returning to this fast food nightmare.
author: Ryan L.

description: I was given reheated CHICKEN katsu ...not only that, I had more fat than meat , and it was flavorless like it was days old... After eating 3 slices I was left with a weird taste in my mouth and a weird stomach feeling .... And the bbq chicken... Is completely dried out and tasteless
author: Dorian M.

description: Surprisingly good for a chain wanna be greasy spoon... so good that I am a returning customer.  My favorite is the Ono Family Meal for $31.99.  You get 3 proteins & two sides, 1 veggie.  I always opt to get 1 chicken bbq &  2 chicken katsu for my protein choices.  My kids actually clean their plate without me having to tell them to!  Happy family :) Lines do get long, but that means they are popular!
author: Maria B.

description: This is like my go-to place for Hawaiian BBQ. I can't think of anywhere else I'd go to for Hawaiian. I love the family dinners. We usually get BBQ Chicken, Chicken Katsu, and Kalua Pork. It's all good. We don't like macaroni salad in general that much so sometimes we ask for just rice instead. You can get it to-go and eat it in the comfort of your own home. It's so goodddd. Definitely come here for the family meals and meat!
author: Amanda L.

description:
The service was good, just a tad bit slow on getting the orders out quick. It sure does get packed very quickly and if you want to dine in it has a very limited amount of tables and seats. 

The food was amazing! I was very satisfied with it and they give you a 20% off coupon for Nubi frozen yogurt which I loved!! And I went straight to Nubi after my amazing meal!
author: Luis R.

description:
I have been giving a bunch of 1 star reviews lately, so I just had to switch things up.  This place gets 5 stars from me.  They are really quick and efficient, and they prep everything from sauces, to opening plastic bags, and stuffing the bags within a bag so that they work at a faster pace.  I usually get the curry chicken katsu.  I really like that the curry is on the side in order to ensure that everything inside the box does not get soggy by the time I get home.  The curry is pretty good.  I usually ask to substitute the macaroni salad with an extra scoop of rice.  When I request this, they always ask if I want rice on the bottom too instead of the greens lining the bottom of the box.  I cannot turn this down, so I say yes!  

Quick service and never disappoints.  I will be coming back again.
author: Victor L.

description:
Was craving Hawaiian food and this spot was the closet since I was starving and ha a craving. This is going to be a two part review. 
First off, Jane, who works the counter is very friendly. I had a question about one of the items on the menu and she explained it to me like a pro. She knows her stuff.  I also notice that she is very patient with the customers when they have questions regarding the menu.  Even tho she had to multitask when the phone rang, she handles it well! 

Ordered a mini katsu and a large kaula pig. Not bad. Would definitely come back. Chicken was crunchy and the kaula pig was just right.
author: Vicki L.

description:
Let me start I haven't been to Ono in sometime and I remember why.

I know it's fast food but today it was slow 20 mins to get my order and the food is the only good part.

Customer service was poor and messed up on everyone's order.

Food was ok. The macaroni salad was the best part
author: Jonathan W.

description:
PATHETIC TO CALL THIS HAWAIIAN
(1 star)

Oh no to Ono Hawaiian BBQ. GHETTO VERSION OF HAWAIIAN FOOD is what it really is. All these little nasty wanna-be Hawaiian eatries are a disgrace. I've been to Hawaii, I know what's good. This ain't good.

- Food, if you like McDees.. you'll like Ono
- Prices, affordable
- Service, fast-food style
- Ambiance, fast-food style

After my cardio workout, I was starving. It is Sunday which happens to be my "fat day - eat whatever you want". I decided to come here and try it because I seem them around and expect Ono to be just like L&L. Pretty much the same thing, but if i had to choose between the two dumps, I'd choose L&L. 

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

GRILLED CHICKEN BREAST (+/- $6) - Not sure what made me come here to try this, but on the menu it had a heart next to it, is that a meaning of "healthy"?!?!. I chose to have lemon pepper over the flavors they had. It was a mini meal so it had a scoop of rice and mac salad. My chicken's texture was kind of like rubber and the lemon pepper was terrible. 

FRESH CUT FRUIT ($2.50) - i was going to assume fresh cut pineapple slices and some island kind of fruits like mango. Instead I already get a pre-cut cup of pineapple, melon, and grapes that looked and tasted like HS cafeteria fruit cups. And for $2.50, you got to be kidding me. I could have gone to Safeway and spend $2.50 on a half of a real ass pineapple and cut some slices.

Will I be back? NO.

Until the next review.....
author: Jane A.

description: Was pretty good!  We called them like 15 minutes before closing and got our food right when we arrived.  Food quality matches the pricing.
author: Alannah P.

description:
This place is not Ono. My chicken came out dry and burnt. The spam musubi is good though. 

What really turned me off though is the snotty little girls working there. Hey,  I'm sorry you don't have a boyfriend. Maybe you should work on your personality to try and change  your situation. 

I'm going to L&L.
author: Victoria W.

description:
Ono? You mean, Oh YES! For about $8, you can get a full meal with your choice of meat, rice, and macaroni salad. The lady and I are not light eaters, and we split the chicken combo meal with hawaiian bbq chicken and chicken katsu. The meat was tender and already flavorful on its own, but I couldn't resist complimenting it further with their delicious sauces. Their teriyaki sauce comes out warm and is not too tangy and not too sweet. Their katsu sauce though is bomb! I was quite tempted to fill a couple of those mini sauce containers and bring that delicious nectar home.

Lost 1 star since the bbq chicken had some tendony bits in it, which I hate..
author: Andrew T.

description:
Will never come here again. 

While waiting, one of the workers dropped a serving tray on the floor then picked it up and put it with the clean ones. Compared to what happened next, that was nothing.

Found 2 hairs in my food! Meat tasted as if it had just been microwaved. Horrible experience overall.
author: Renzo L.

description: This was my first time trying hawaiian food, so this place had good food but I don't know if this is what I should expect. The food was good, the only bad thing will be that they do take forever. Fortunately for me the cashier was flirting with my friend and hurry things up.
author: Rosa A. F.

description: Usually at least a 10-15 wait no matter if you order an entire meal or just an order of spam musubi. But its delicious and so close to home I can't help but come back :)
author: Elsa C.

description: Ono's has a variety of hawaiian food.  The portions are pretty big.  Around $7-8 for a plate.  I got the chicken katsu.  I really wanted to get the bbq chicken also, but I resisted spending that extra bit.  The mac was goood.  You get your own sauces from the counter and you can ask for a bag to hold the sauces if you'd like to take it home so it won't spill.  The musubis seem a bit pricey ):
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
COUPONSSSS.

This place gives you a coupon to Nubi if you buy something. Pretty sweet. The food is alright. Good for a quick meal. Staff are nice and friendly. The wait for food isn't too long. The best thing I've tried is probably the spam musubi and the chicken katsu. They are probably the most ordered that I've heard of and they're yummy! The only downside when you order the #3 (chicken katsu with teriyaki chicken, macaroni, rice, and veggies) the veggies are soaked in oil. Pretty gross. No one wants to eat veggies drowned in oil. Besides that, the food is alright.
author: Vernice T.

description:
The katsu sauce here is THE BEST!! It's so sweet and delicious. I love getting chicken misubi and dip it in warm teriyaki sauce. Mmmmm! 

This is great if you need a quick lunch to grab or if you feel like Hawaiian food. Granted, other places give you more portions, but who wants to stuff their faces in food anyway? I think it's just the right amount.

Also, if you need to check the calories they have it available online!
author: Jade F.

description: Hawaiin bbq is a relatively new discovery for me. I first tried Ono with my friends and was surprised by how good everything tasted and why I had never heard of it before. The meal ran me about $10, but left me absolutely stuffed. I will definitely be coming back here next time I need a fix of rice, meat, and sauce!
author: Jacob A.

description:
For the money, the food is very decent. It's a popular place where students from a nearby high school come to grab an quick lunch.  Located at Lakeshore Plaza where the anchor store is Lucky supermarket.

We ordered the mini meal for lunch on our recent visit.  If you're familiar with Hawaiian mixed plates, your meal comes with two scops of white rice and a scoop of Mac salad. And generous entree portions.  Chicken katsu, mahi mahi, kalua pork, etc.

With the mini meal, you get  one scoop of rice, one scoop of macaroni salad, and choice of meat item atop some fresh pieces of cabbage.  What's not to like.  Only $5.59.  I got the spicy and sweet island chicken.  Morsels of chicken meat cooked in a nice glaze sauce.  It was good.

Food is fresh and ample, and cooked once you order at the counter.  Pay at the counter and wait until your number is called.

A few tables indoor and several immediately outside.  Great to eat outdoors if not cold and foggy.
author: Shirley N.

description:
I came here and got the summer special for $6.99
Got Teriyaki Chicken and Chicken Katsu and it came with 2 scoops of rice, fresh fruit, and a soda. We also ordered 2 spam musubis. 
I would have to say the food actually tastes pretty good but the downside is that the portions are pretty small. I would come back to try other things on their menu.
author: Peter C.

description: Do these fools add dopamine to the rice they sell? I am wondering this because I ate it at 6 pm and I could smell it all night long. This place is really close to my house so I come often but lately I have been worried about the ingredients the food may have and I have several concerns whether all of them have been approved by the FDA.
author: Sylvester C.

description:
I remember when Ono just opened I thought that this place was not as good as L&L but still fulfills my Hawaiian BBQ craving. In the beginning the mini meal deal was great. You would get so much meat, a nice helping of rice and macaroni salad. But as the years went by the portion of meat got smaller and degraded in quality. If you are in the neighborhood and want Hawaiian BBQ this place is a good choice. 

What I recommend:

Hawaiian BBQ Mix - BBQ chicken, beef, and kalbi short ribs
Chicken Combo - BBQ chicken and katsu chicken
author: Andrew W.

description:
I now know what expired chicken tastes like thanks to this place.  It cost me about 12 bucks to discover this.  I ate the "grilled" chicken which is different from the bbq'd chicken.  I wouldn't be surprised if they were using expired chicken knowingly.  Had to toss the chicken out.  WTF is up with this place? 

I've had the BBQ chicken here as well as the beef.  Beef would be your best bet if you ate here.  The mac and the rice tasted fine.
author: Koa K.

description: Everything was greasy and what really ticked me off aside from bad food is terrible customer service. I asked the Asian girl at the counter if my meal came with a drink she said yes and I only found out later that it did not. I am never coming back to this POS pathetic excuse of a "restaurant" that can't even provide a restroom for your patrons. There's a reason they serve you greasy food--so you can run the heck away as quickly as possible to find a restroom...
author: Geraldine C.

description:
No seating and the place was mobbed with high schoolers. The staff didn't do much to tell these kids how rude they were being until the kids started banging on the windows and started causing damage to the business. Even then, they were only told to stop and were not asked to leave. As a customer, I feel it is not my spot to tell these kids to shut up because I am bringing my money to business for an experience, and confronting people is not part of that expected experience.

Other than that, the food was not too bad, but I don't know if I will be returning customer in the future especially when I have had better Hawaiian BBQ at a better price at other places.
author: Michael M.

description: Don't order ahead of time on the phone!  They don't make your food until you show up and pay for it.  So calling ahead to cut down on your wait time is useless!
author: Jeremy B.

description: Just like Hawaii!  Updating my 2011 review. Different menu or cooks but avoid the Katsu.  It's either the type of breads crumbs, batter or oil but it leaves a bad taste in your mouth. Get the BBQ beef plate.
author: Gerald H.

description:
I like chicken katzu here very much. And i gave them 5 stars before.
Everytime i come here i just order chicken katzu. This time I'm very disappointed. Before, the chicken was delicious and thick, i can't finish them in a meal. But this time the chicken is thin as a paper.
author: Sabrina W.

description:
5 STARS SOOO YUMMMY!!!!!!!! I don't care if it takes forever, it tastes SOOOOOOO GOOD!!!!!!!!!!!!

My new usual is now the Hawaiian BBQ Mix http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dJ4bSlqY3a5uU14WRqBrzA?select=DoP1NSTdu46stKq9hiH7pA & Spam Musubi http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dJ4bSlqY3a5uU14WRqBrzA?select=5lah3qKIdtzkgITNM85ceg , but if I get it, I have to share it with someone. I think it's a good amount for 2 people, for one, even with my big appetite, I can't finish it.

5 STARS, even though there isn't much seating, although I do like to sit outside on not so foggy/freezing days. No bathrooms, just go to Luckys or Petco. They accept credit cards. Inexpensive. YUMMY!!!!!!!!! 5 Stars, still 5 stars.
author: Kylie L.

description: Review Ono Hawaiian BBQ? My review is in the name.. O no. I received an aloha plate aka all cabbage no chicken plate which left me quite disappointed in my Hawaiian brothers and sisters. They trying to starve us out here... if you want bigger portions for a better price I suggest you go elsewhere over this location. Smh.
author: Meagan N.

description:
I saw this Ono's on the way out of this plaza. To get to this little area, you have to go down this one way area, so you can't go back the same way to get back into the plaza. You would need to continue out and eventually turn on the main street.

I ordered a Chicken Katsu. There were two other people in front of me but I still waited awhile to get my food. The sauces are on the side and you can get as much as you want. When I got my food, the lady offered a small plastic bag for the sauce and gave me an extra fork since she saw me with my roommate.

The Chicken Katsu tasted good. It seems like the same amount of food that I normally get from other Onos. However, I think this place gave a little more cabbage than other places. 

Overall, though the wait seemed a little long, the quality of this Onos is just as good as other Onos.

Pros:
-Good Chicken Katus

Cons:
-A little wait to get food but not too bad
-One-way to get to the Ono's parking area. Need to drive around to get back into main plaza
author: Paul U.

description: When I'm craving for Hawaiian food and I'm on the sunset side of town this is where I go to for my fix. The food is between a good and okay. It's pretty consistent. Today my chicken Katsu and bbq chicken tasted fresh off the grill so I was happy. Because some times you go to these type of joints and the food just taste like its been sitting there for awhile. Yuck. But they were on point today so three stars for them.
author: Susan M.

description: If you don't want to spend too much on dinner,  this is the place for you.  It's fast and not pricey. I always order the seafood mix and always get myself stuffed. Try it, you might like it if you have too much subway lately.
author: May M.

description:
I strongly dislike how they took away the self-serve sauce station. Because guess what? They forgot to put in any sauce into my family meal. Now we got four people eating very greasy katsu chicken without any sauce to go with it. Not to mention the BBQ beef has multiple chunks of nothing but BBQ beef FAT.

This is WHY they had a self serve sauce station in the first place... so, to the manager who decided to take that away from the store, you made a mistake.

Also, I have been poisoned by their macaroni salad a few times before. This review was a long time coming for them.
author: V L.

description:
Seriously oh no..

I had the chicken katsu. The thing is half breading. If you eat your chicken katsu and halfway in you take apart the breading and chicken, they're something wrong. If you eat your mac salad, and when you're done, instead of feeling satisfied, you feel like you're sick of it, there's something wrong. This is what I heard when I went today.

I hate three or four pieces (less than half) of my set and I couldn't take the breading anymore. I just stopped all together. They filled my rice way pass the halfway mark for the mac salad and rice. To go and for here's only difference is that, for here, you get a tray. There's really no point in asking.

The only thing good, I feel, is that your receipt gives you 20% off Nubi.
author: Stacy C.

description: Food poisoning from the hawaiian beef plate on sat night. Would think mac salad would be the culprit and thinking back it did taste a little different but it's the thought of the beef that has me wanting to die..ugh either way I'm sooo damn sick from this place
author: Emma H.

description: It's a nice quick and affordable spot to get your Hawaiian bbq craving... I ordered the seafood mix to go and it was pretty good, I like their fried prawns and white fried fish as well as their macaroni salad, it tasted good and just right, however the rice seemed a bit too dry and hard and they forgot to add bbq sauce on my chicken, so don't forget to double check your order before you leave (which I should've done!) other than that as is well.
author: Kyli J.

description:
Popcorn shrimp: 3/5 stars-- I'd prefer more shrimp than crispy batter.

Spam masubi: 5/5- I was surprised at how big and mouthwatering the spam masubi is. Comes with 2 pieces and is so worth it. I think I'd be happy just sitting in mounds of spam masubi in Costco overlooking the crowds like Queen Masubi.

BBQ chicken: 4/5 - Very moist!

Macaroni salad- 4/5 I usually don't like mayonnaise in anything, but this mac salad is an exception. 

Also if you go to Ono and show the receipt to Nubi nearby, you get 20% off!  Dinner and dessert!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I agree with Antonio and others -- this place is just a'ight.  It does have good value and I appreciate their having brought in chicken breast option, as I'm not a fan of dark meat unless it comes off the type of really good rotisserie chickens, which these aren't.  And they do give you a lot of the sliced chicken breast and I appreciate that..  Their soup is fine and I like that they offer those Hawaiian drinks.

That all being said, this has to be the SLOWEST service ever.  Three times I have been there, placed my order, and it shouldn't take more than 10 minutes -- I'm usually waiting 20-25.  If this were for sit-down, that would be one thing, but  this is, for the most part, fast food.  Last time I showed the manager the time on the receipt that the order was taken and then showed him what time it was as he gave me my food and told him it shouldn't take this long and he sort of laughed it off.

I will say -- I have been to the other location in Colma and don't recall the service being this slow at all, and the food tasting a bit better.
author: Merrick W.

description: They use low-grade dark chicken so stick to the other meats. Their mini meals are perfect if you have a smaller appetite and it will still make you ridiculously full. It comes with a scoop of rice, macaroni salad, and your choice of meat for under $10.
author: Anastasia P.

description:
No Loco Moco!?!?

Be it this location or all Ono Hawaiian BBQ locations, but why would you take the loco moco off the menu?  Isn't the loco moco a staple of Hawaiian food?  I was struck dumbfounded with a dilemma because that was the only thing I order at any Hawaiian oriented place.  

It's been awhile since my last visit, there were a few new things I noticed.  Chicken breast was a new choice of meat, pre-sliced cutlets of chicken breast over peppered and extremely salty.  They now have spam and eggs on the menu officially.  An expansion into the experimental realm of noodle soups has begun.  The bowl of noodle soup tasted like a microwaved concoction of canned noodles and vegetables.    

Most of all orders come with the macaroni salad like I remembered.  Overall consensus I have come across on the macaroni salad is one or the other, massive addiction or complete disgust.  This is probably the most consistent item at all Hawaiian fast food restaurants.      

The service at this branch was very courteous and the cashier even sympathized with my cruel inner dealing of their lack of loco moco.  Hawaiian fast food has hit a minor chord and its name is Ono.  Why aim for a healthier angle?  Isn't everything fried, deep fried, or grilled in a bunch of oil anyway?  A bed of cabbage amounting to more than the meat served isn't going to make the katsu less deep fried.  

Please bring back the Loco Moco.
author: Arnold T.

description:
The food at this location is AIGHT... the katsu is descent and the spam musubi is good. Only thing is its SLOOOWW... 
so you're better off calling in your order and dropping by in like 20 minutes to pick it up 
OR you can go in, order, welk to luckys buy a drink come back wait a while and then get your food. Either way the food's ok and the prices are good!
author: Antonio W.

description:
I'm no Hawaiian BBQ expert but I do appreciate a good BBQ meal and Ono does just that. If you're a SF State student and have a night class, your late dinner options are very limited. A quick search on Yelp and Ono was one of my options along with the food court at Stonestown, which closes at 9p.m. Ono stays open until 10:30p.m. and shouldn't worry about being rushed out.

I was going to go with the chicken combo, until I saw the Hawaiian BBQ Mix, which includes BBQ Chicken, BBQ Beef, and Kalbi Short Ribs. Ono bills it as "A meat lover's favorite". Immediately after paying for my meal, my stomach sank as I saw the nutritional information for my carnivore plate. Let's just say that if you're health conscious, stick to the chicken.

With regret in full swing, I dug in to my BBQ Mix and the chicken and beef were first up. The meat was tender and flavorful without any additional sauce or condiments. The steamed rice and macaroni salad were the perfect compliment to the meat plate. In a sign of defeat, I didn't touch my short ribs and threw in the towel. In all fairness, it's a lot of food for one person, especially for $9.

I was contemplating downgrading one star, but figured it's my fault for ordering the BBQ Mix and not asking for the nutritional information beforehand. Nevertheless, the food is good, especially for $9 and at 9:30p.m. when not much else is open. A drawback is its location as I don't picture myself coming back  if I don't have my car on campus. 

Ambiance: 3 Stars (out of 5) 
Food: 4 Stars (out of 5)
Service: N/A
Price: $
Overall: 4 Stars (out of 5)

Pros:
+ BBQ chicken and beef
+ Reasonably priced
+ Large portions
+ Late hours

Cons:
- Location
author: Alexander E.

description:
Ono is a good value even if you don't use the coupons that come in the mail all the time or the coupon on your Nubi Yogurt receipt.  Come hungry.  The regular size plate lunches ($6.89 - $8.09) are large enough for two people (or two meals) or you can get a mini plate lunch for $4.99, burger ($4.19), noodle soup, musubi, or salad.  They have $5 value meals that include a drink, 2 scoops of rice, veggies and an entree.  All the carbs and protein make for a very filling meal.  Choose from chicken, mahi mahi, crispy shrimp, kalbi, BBQ beef, loco moco and kalua pork.

I decided to try something different, Island Curry Chicken ($7.09).  It wasn't a soupy curry at all.  I think it was their BBQ grilled boneless & skinless marinated chicken with a mild yellow curry sauce poured on top and a few chunks of potatoes, carrots and onions.  

Hmm.  It was strange (I've never had BBQ chicken in a curry before) but they didn't skimp on the meat.  It was cut the way their BBQ chicken comes (big pieces, boneless).  The chicken was quite tender and the marinade was on the salty side (not too bad, the rice and bland macaroni salad help) with a bit of sweetness.  I was looking for more curry flavor.  The chicken was accompanied by one big scoop of steamed white rice and a plain creamy macaroni salad, heavy on the mayo, with carrot shreds.  

The atmosphere is what you'd expect for fast food though the food takes awhile to arrive.  The soda fountain machine is in the dining area (free refills).  They also sell Hawaiian drinks.  

The clientele is mostly young and Asian (they probably like fro-yo too).  My receipt had a coupon for 20% off at Nubi, good for 14 days.  Nubi business cards were kept by the register.
author: Lolia S.

description:
[M]ona: 3 Stars
[W]ayne: 3 Stars
Average: 3 Stars

+ Good Value
+ Coupon from Nubi Yogurt

[M] Hmm, I have mixed feelings about this place... The food here is yummy but they don't always seem to keep their consistency. My food is sometimes hot and sometimes cold. Usually on the hot side though. I normally get their mini meals in BBQ Ribs or Beef. If coming in pair and not in the mood for much food, the normal sized meals are large enough for 2 people to share. The Macaroni Salad here is also very good : )
author: Mona C.

description:
When my options are limited, of course I finally decided to go into Ono's after much talks about how my friends love it. I did very much enjoy their chicken musubi here. 
Quick bite, nothing to brag about.
author: Lisa T.

description: I ordered the spicy chicken meal and an order of chicken misubi togo. I decided I wanted to eat before I got home thats when things got interesting. My food was cold the chicken was obviously pre-cooked and my misubi seaweed had the consistency of rubber. I returned the chicken meal and told them it was cold. The waitress asked the cook if he had cooked it...he said yes. Only after I returned my food did I hear the wok sizzle in the back. This goes in my top ten worst experiences ever.
author: Lauren Y.

description:
Ono has some of the best macaroni salad I've had. When I come to Ono, I tell them to swap out that useless rice and give me an extra scoop of mac salad. When it comes to their mac salad, I aint playin around. 

I used to order their chicken katsu but I could only take so much of the fried skin. Now that I've switched to their bbq chicken, it makes the meal so much more enjoyable. Pair the bbq chicken with the katsu or teriyaki dipping sauces you can get from the pump near the soda fountain, and it's a match made in heaven. The mini meals are good for children or if you're not too hungry, but if you're starving like Marvin, then I recommend the regular meal.

My tummy gives Ono Hawaiian BBQ...4 Stars!
author: Allan L.

description: It's a simple meal for a high price, but I do not recommend ordering when busy.. the beef and chicken was not fully cooked
author: Dante L.

description: My absolute go to. But don't go during launch. I notice that the meat to rice ratio during lunch and dinner is completely different. It's the chef I bet but can't hate on the business tactic.
author: Jackie B.

description:
This place has gone downhill since it's glory days when it first opened. I'd like to attribute that to my resignation back in 2007, but for the sake of argument, I'll provide alternative reasons other than management.

First off, they took off some hot items off the menu like the infamous Loco Moco and all the burgers. I just can't fathom why. It can't be for a healthier selection because let's face it, nobody goes to Hawaiian BBQ to slim down. NOBODY! The Mahi Burger was nothing short of greatness. Now it's just nothing but a memory. Another let down is the fact that they never offered fries. How do you sell burgers and not fries?! 

Although their Hawaiian drinks are pretty good, $1.62 a pop is a little pricey considering you can pick up a six-pack of those bad boys at Ranch 99 for around that price. I don't know why, but their fountain Barq's Root Beer is one of the best fountains around, too.

The one thing that they still have going for them is their Kalbi Short Ribs is still spectacular. I've once ate breakfast, lunch, and dinner at Ono's for four months straight to save up for my motorcycle and I can safely say the short ribs never gets old. I hope to God none of you are ever put in that position, but just know the Short Ribs remains your safest bet. 

The Spam Musubi is still pretty good too. But it's pretty hard to screw that up. 

Other than that, nothing really stands out. Mediocre selection, lack of awesome employees, contagious greasy aura, it's an Okay at best.
author: Andrew A.

description: Word of advice, if a customer order chicken katsu TO-GO, you might wanna put the katsu sauce in their bag.....otherwise they don't realize it till they're already home. It's stupid how you have to grab the sauce yourself how is someone who's never been there before supposed to know that?
author: Kryssa T.

description:
This place gets 2 stars for the following reasons:
1) the register lady was sort of rude for not saying "thank you", "you're welcome", "bye" or anything of that sort.
2) the chicken Katsu is consistently hard and way to over fried
3) they forgot the sauce (but I suppose it's partially my fault for not checking before leaving)

I haven't had a meal that terrible for quite a while.
LNL Hawaiian is so much better.
author: Darrell L.

description: The quality of the meat that they serve here is so cheap.  It's a sad excuse for food, but there aren't many options for Hawaiian in the area.  The short ribs are extremely fatty, the chicken katsu has more breading than meat and the fish tastes like freezer.  The only thing I really like and get here is the spam masubi, but I guess it's cause you can't really mess that up.
author: Tina L.

description: I've been to this place for quite a while. It appears I've been poisoned on my last visit.  I think the problem is the cooks not as much as the owner or the restaurant.  In most case the owner don't even know what's going on. Of course the cooks don't realized that people are paying their wage not the owner. If they understand, they wouldn't be working there and be bosses instead. In most cases to my experience owners hire incompetent people that ruins their business and they don't even know it.
author: Robin T236532i9 W.

description:
Two thumbs down ...

I only came in because I was dying for something to drink. Ended up picking up some crab rangoons while I was there. 6 for $4. 

What really disappointed me was how long the wait was. It seems there were 4-5 orders ahead of me and I quickly realized everyone sitting down was waiting for their orders as well. I had to wait almost 15-20 minutes standing for 6 little appetizers. My feet were hurting, but I guess they had a lot of orders to cook before they cooked mine.

When I finally got mine, I could not believe my food was lukewarm!! That's just b.s. There was absolutely no reason for me having to wait if they did not have to cook it. L&L will bypass everyone and give me my order ahead of others if the food was ready to go without cooking. Wtf.

To top it off, they don't have sauce for it (sweet and sour) and it was just cream cheese no crab.
author: Carol A.

description:
I love this place! Why all the bad reviews??

First off, the place has a private lot, which is a huge two thumbs up in my book. I am so tired of pulling out 8+ quarters for parking in San Francisco!!

Second, the food offers huge portions!!! I had the bbq chicken lunch plate which came with two scoops rice, 1 scoop macaroni, and three or four slices of bbq chicken.  The chicken was tender and delicious!

Third, service was super fast and prices are reasonable.

This place makes me miss Hawaii and makes me forget about my diet. =)
author: Janet E.

description:
Since I go to Hawaii every year, my standards for Hawaiian food have slightly raised. I haven't been here in ages and I finally came here around 7pm on a Thursday night. It was pretty full of people...
....full of people waiting for their food.

My parents and I came into Ono because there was a wait at King of Thai across the way.  I ordered the Hawaiian mix, which has bbq teriyaki chicken, beef, and 1 rib.  My parents got #3, mixture of teriyaki chicken and chicken katsu.  I don't care very much for their chicken katsu as the batter on the outside is quite thick and tasteless. The rib was a little dry and chewy,but the beef was very tender and flavorful.  Call me weird, but besides the beef, I enjoyed the cabbage on the bottom of my meat the most.

They somehow lost our ticket so everybody who ordered after us received their food first.  When I approached a worker, she just said, "it's not ready" while the cooks in the back were saying, "I never saw that order." The other girl was pretty shady with the napkins.  We got 2 napkins between the 3 of us. One napkin was used to wipe the table since it was pretty sticky. I asked for more napkins and she just gave me one.

On the upside, their spam masubis are pretty good.
author: Cheryl Q.

description:
This location makes me so angry that I was blowing off steam up until the time I ordered up until I got the food. 

Takes FOREVER & years to get my darn food!!! Seriously if you're in a hurry, mind as well get faster food than this fast food place. 

Ordered a mini katsu & larger order of katsu. WHY, WHY in a non busy place did it take 20-30minutes?!!!! ARE YOU KIDDING ME?! To top it all off, these incompetent cashiers, servers, whatever DID NOT give me the sauces, there should have been 3. 

Customer service is everything. Lucky the food was tasty, good thing this didn't change, therefore the extra star.
author: Christine F.

description: I called in an order for a BBQ mix plate & side order of Mac salad. They usually serve fresh food but what I had in my plate yesterday looked & tastes like it was leftovers from the day before. The beef & short ribs were burnt, the chicken was  rubbery & burnt to crisp. I didn't realize all this till I got home & I was just too tired to drive back & demand a refund. I will definitely think twice before coming back again.
author: Cici V.

description: This is my first time trying it and I think it is good for what it is worth, I have been to other hawaiian places and they are a little better that this but over all great for a quick grab to eat.  I would come here again.
author: Saul A.

description:
love ono's but came here to order for my family. My dad wanted a loco moco and my mom wanted a chicken katsu musubi. they didnt have any of these!! what kind of hawaiian bbq place doesn't have a LOCO MOCO?! 

their portions are bigger than L&L but it might be more expensive. i got the BBQ chicken and it was good. they also have fast service!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
What kind of Hawaiian Restaurant does not sell loco-mocos?

WHAT A TRAVESTY!
author: Forest S.

description: Poor quality of meat- I shouldn't have hard pieces in my chicken that I have to take out of my mouth. Good Mac salad though. Won't be going back. Plus, 20 mins for takeout?
author: Patrick D.

description: This place was alright. Service was terrible. But the food is good. Stupid workers but kudos to the cooks.
author: Jared B.

description:
Thought I would write some words, since I just finished a meal from Ono and tho I've been there many times, haven't yelped. 

The food is ok. I've tried almost everything on the menu and it is usually pretty consistently ok. I usually stick with the bbq or teri chicken (which taste almost the same, I think the only difference is the teri sauce they put on top!) and kalua pork, which is my favorite dish. When Ono is on, their pork is tender and flavorful. When Ono is off, the pork can be a little dry. I don't really like their beef dishes - I think the cut of beef you get for the price is just not tender at all. I'm also not a fan of the katsu sauce they use, although the katsu is pretty decent. Stay away from the curry - it is the worst possible excuse for curry I've ever tried from a hawaiian fast food joint. 

Lastly the spam musabi is pretty good, although they do make it the lazy way (Ono wraps the nori around the rice and spam, but with the spam touching the nori. For wraps (and not just a strip) imo it should be rice, spam, rice, and the nori all around the whole thing.)
author: Dom L.

description:
I haven't been here in months, so I don't know what the quality and service is like nowadays.  When it first opened up though, I thought this place was great...relatively genuine Hawaiian food that actually tastes pretty decent for the money.  However, I have to admit that over time, you could see that the service was starting to slip a bit, and the friendly workers they started with were no longer around.

That said, I think they still do a pretty good job with the food though.  The Chicken Combo (BBQ Chicken and Chicken Katsu) is a personal favorite.  The portions are generous, and you could split it over two meals and still be full with just eating half of the order.  In addition to the main items, there's also a serving of cabbage (meh...it's cabbage) and macaroni salad, which tastes much better than Hawaiian Drive Inn's.  They also do the spam musubi pretty well, with two per order and the right portion of meat/rice/sauce.

Despite any drop-offs in service, I've only done takeout so any exposure is pretty limited.  As long as the food stays close to the same quality, and the portions don't shrink, I'd still make a return trip or two.
author: Mike L.

description:
This is a 94132 Parkside Gem...Lakeshore Plaza The ol' GET.

Good Eatin' I had Yoko Ono Yesterday and Today.... I added this food to "My Last Meal"  I am in love with the Chicken Terayaki. It must be the secret sauce.
