Hawaiian barbecue restaurants usually feature large plates of rice, macaroni salad, and some other fried or barbecued meat and/or seafood (usually referred to as "plate lunches"). Many will feature other Japanese hybrid foods, such as  katsu (meat--breaded and fried).

I like to substitute the Mayonnaise Macaroni for another scoop of white rice.  I never eat in. Always take out. I eat in my car sometimes.

Infodiva out,,,,,maybe I will pick my teeth for remnants. hahaha
author: Infodiva B.

description: THE WORST customer service I've experienced! I've ate here before and never had problems, but the night staff tonight was ridiculously horrible. First of all, I ordered for pick up and they said it would take 10-15 minutes. Got there, I guess they put it under the wrong name and our cashier Sarah He assumed we called the wrong location. After straightening it out, we waited another 10 minutes for our food, but everyone else that ordered after us were getting served first. After asking about my order, it was sitting on their back counter the ENTIRE time I was there. They were too busy trying to close instead of paying attention to their customers. Unbelievable how bad they were and I will definitely be calling management to let them know so they can prevent situations like this from happening again.
author: Jessica U.

description:
My sister bought take out for me from here.  I don't know, maybe it was lukewarm when she got to my house but I'm underwhelmed.  I had teri chicken.  Hated the damn cabbage. Reminded me of those awful meals you get on a China tour (every meal came w/ overcooked cabbage!).  Chicken was a little too bland for my taste.

I absolutely hate mac salad (there I said it!)!
author: Wendy H.

description: If you want plentiful, cheap and sorta fast Hawaiian grindz, then this will do just fine.  Typical island foods enuff to fill you up for sure.
author: Joel M.

description:
Normally I would probably give this place 3 stars.

This review however is for their catering service.  I specifically asked that our order be ready for pick-up when they first opened because I had to drive an hour out to the North Bay for an event that started at 12.  I scheduled just enough time to get there and set-up.   The gentleman who was at the counter confirmed that they would have it ready right when they opened.  However, when I got there on the day of the event the service staff told me that they don't open till 11 and made me wait an additional 25 minutes till all the platters were ready. This is completely unacceptable.
author: Stacey L.

description:
You raised your mini meal price from $4.99 to $5.29! O NO! But...OK...I guess prices for everything has raised to combat inflation. But the mini meal is the only thing I order at Ono's (with Chicken Katsu).

What does a $5.29 (at the moment) mini-meal consist of? A side of whatever meat you decide, a scoop of macaroni salad, a scoop of rice, and a side of lettuce (you can exchange the side of lettuce of a side of macaroni salad). And the Katsu sauce is bomb, but they only give you limited servings now. Before, the Katsu and BBQ sauce were self-served. 

Why only 3 stars? Even though your macaroni salad is good, I always get a stomach ache after eating it. Always. But I never learn because it is so good. Too much mayonnaise + Katsu Sauce = Stomach Not Feel So Good.

I'll come back when I have forgotten again how I always get stomach aches from eating here...it'll be bliss for that half an hour eating but torture for the two hours afterwards. Worth It.
author: David W.

description:
OY..what I would give for just a little bit of consistency in this place! 

Today I went back and ordered my usual lemon pepper chicken.

It wasn't NEARLY as spicy as I wanted it! No heat...oh well, its still good food. 

The complaint I have today is that I told the manager that the coke was out and he didnt really acknowledge me and walked in the back....a few minutes later he came out and said the coke is ready to go.

Its good food at a reasonable price....I am a regular there :)
author: Dennis N.

description: Great food, great people.  I'm constantly amazed at how fantastic the staff is, particularly for a fast food chain.  Fantastic!
author: Mystery V.

description:
Of all the quick take-out Hawaiian BBQ joints, this is my favorite:  the servings are huge, the meats and chicken aren't overcooked or chewy, and in fact the bbq chicken is moist and delicious!  

The macaroni salad is flavorful and not overly watery, the way some other places are.  It also doesn't have a lot of questionable fillers, and tastes a lot more like what you'd get on a Hawaiian Island than most other local places!

If you're going to get fast food, you might as well go here:  you'll get something a little healthier (chicken, rice, cabbage, hold the macaroni if you're on a diet!) than the burger joints, and something that tastes a lot closer to homemade than many of the other overprocessed chain restaurants.  This isn't gourmet food, but it's tasty, you can get smaller portion sizes for less money, and if you decide to dine-in, you'll sit on a clean chair, eating while listening to Hawaiian-style reggae, just like what you'd hear on the radio stations in HI!!

This place is simple, fast, delicious, very inexpensive, and the service is always pleasant...what more could you ask for?!
author: Amy L.

description:
Once upon a time I used to eat here everyday because I worked across the ways at Tully's (which now sucks).  But back to the task at hand, the review for Ono:

So here's your ideal location if you're looking for something hot, greasy and flavorful.  I was always a sucker for the spam musubi, chicken katsu or BBQ chicken.  I can't say that Ono is "Da Kine Grinds" because we all know the L&L is way better, but for it's location, Ono was smart to open up here.
author: Edrian D.

description:
On Blockbuster nights I usually grab food to go from this place.  (Blockbuster is right across the parking lot.. duh) 
At night, there seems to be many college kids from SF State hanging out here. Not that I have a problem with it, but it's just somewhat annoying when an actual customer wants to find a place to sit and eat their meal but every spot is taken up by them and they're not eating! Leave already! 
Ahh but I digress..

I am actually NOT a fan of Hawaiian Drive In, that place has made me sick each time I have had it. I try and I try to like the macaroni salad, but I just can't. 

Ono on the other hand, I can eat their macaroni salad. I think they use less mayo than Hawaiian Drive In so it's edible. 
I usually order the short ribs and they're always cooked perfectly, they give a good amount of rice and I eat the entire thing. 
They have never screwed up my order,  it costs a bit more than L&L or Hawaiian Drive In but the food tastes better. You get your moneys worth here and plus, I have NEVER gotten sick from eating here. 

It's located inside a plaza (Albertsons, Ross, Big 5, Tully's Coffee, a post office, Blockbuster, Game Stop, etc ) so you can easily finish multiple errands while visiting .  Just know that the corner that Ono is in has weird parking. There's less space in this corner so parking is kind of tight. If you are willing to walk, park closer towards Albertson's.
author: Susy C.

description:
This place is probably my favorite  place to get Hawaiian food and its only 5 mins away from my house which is a plus :).
I wish they still had their fire island chicken. I really liked that it was kinda spicy and yet it was so good.  My other favorite is the BBQ Beef.  The beef is so tender it like melts in your mouth. I also like the BBQ short ribs because they actually fall off the bones.  I hate it when some places the ribs still stick right onto the bones.  Also the spam and chicken masubi is probably the best I've ever tasted.  I really cant get enough of this place, I order this place almost ever weekend.  Its just that good.
author: JC C.

description:
Oh No to the Ono Burger!

The Ono Burger really SUCKS!.
The hamburger patty was so dried out like calluses.
But, a problem was, ..... I ate it. 
because I WAS SO HUNGRY! 
Shame on me!
I didn't want to go Arby's.
Arby's is disgusting. 

I like the Chicken-Katsu and Ton-Katsu very much.
So, why bother order the burger?
FXXX THE Shit!
What the FXXX was I thinking?
I wasn't thinking. 
I was expecting the same as the other menus like BBQ chicken, ton-katsu, chicken-katsu and the macaroni salad, shit like that.
Those items are pretty good.

Hey, I have an idea.
How about the Chicken-Katsu-Sandwich instead?

The Chicken-Katsu Combo is great portion so I always save the Chicken-Katsu later for my 2nd meal. Sometimes I make a sandwich with the left over Chicken-Katsu.

It'll be a great new item for Ono's Chicken-Katsu-Sandwich.
author: Nobu K.

description:
Surprisingly decent Hawaiian food.  I usually order the chicken katsu; comes with a good portion of meat, rice, macaroni salad and cabbage for $8.04 including tax.  The Katsu is ok.  The rice and macaroni salad are very good.  About a ten minute wait, which isn't bad if you need to do business close by (Lucky's, the bank, etc).

The space is a little small and not a lot of room to sit.  The service people here seem disinterested, but expected for a fast food place.
author: R L.

description:
Hey braddah, you wanna go grind? Shoots cuz, let's go to da kine! Auwe! Ono's again brah?!? Faka wot!?!

Typical Hawaiian style plate lunch place. Either BBQ or deep fried meat selection accompanied with rice & mac salad. Feeling hungry then go for the mix plate, not so hungry then get the mini plate. Can't beat the Loco Moco for a hangover! No Hawaiian Sun though. :-(

Inoskedu Ono's!
author: Gary T.

description:
They need more space for dining in.Also,the meats tend to be way over
marinated and super salty.However,my kids like it,so I grin and bear it!
Not my favorite place,but edible.

Update- try the Loco Moco or the Seafood Noodle Soup. Best things on the menu!
author: Buddha B.

description:
Did you know that pineapples are not native to Hawaii at all? Yep, that's right -- they're originally from Brazil. 

After eating a whole crap of fried meats here, my tummy wasn't very happy with me so I did some research on Hawaiian food and discovered that there are two categories of Hawaiian food - modern & traditional.

This, people (in case you haven't figured it out), is modern Hawaiian food, which means HIGH FAT! I don't feel like developing heart disease, thank you.

If you're in the area and absolutely starving, I guess I can understand -- they do give big portions -- just make sure you eat some fruit afterwards or you're gonna be spending lots of time on the "Hawaiian throne".
author: Cathrin P C.

description: My backup place for dinner.. Not really the best but dont really mind eating here if necessary...
author: John M.

description: Damn good Hawaiian.  Generous portion size, I often share with a friend.  Place gets real crowed so it takes a while to get your food, but it's worth it.  I go there monthly.  If I lived nearby I would gain some serious weight.
author: Zed Z.

description:
It's not the greatest Hawaiian food, but it's not terrible.  Considering it's the closest place to me that serves Hawaiian food, I'll take what I can get.

Every time I come here, I get the mix plate, because you get a variety of meats.  Chicken is usually good, the Kalbi has always been good and the BBQ beef is always ok in flavor. I also enjoy the mac salad it comes with.

Their Spam Musubi and Crab Rangoon are good, but they both feel over priced.  Actually everything is a little on the expensive side, but it's mostly noticeable with those two items, because they're both small and not very filling.
Also, just like many other reviews, I wish they had Loco Moco.  That alone may have bumped my review up to a 4th star (assuming it was good)

The service is good, all of the employees are nice.  The cooking is a little slow though. I wish they had a waiting area, instead you're just awkward standing near a table where someone else is eating.  I usually wait outside, but then you have to guess when your food is ready.
author: Andrew H.

description:
It sucked. 
Too salty bbq ribs.
Macaroni salad was all mayo!
katsu was kinda blah! 

Parking sucks here too!
author: Erika G.

description: Chicken combo was so yummy... I came here at lunch time even it was so busy the guys work really fast and in 10 minutes I got my delicious food . Now feel so full can't move !!!
author: Kevin S.

description:
COME ON IT'S RIGHT NEXT TO BLOCKBUSTER!!!..  Food is good but cost is high.  Coming out of Blockbuster you could smell the food cooking, its mesmerizing.   Don't get me wrong the food is good however what I need is:

I NEED MORE meat on my short ribs!!!  You know the piece of meat with the 3 bones..  I usually get  3 bones held together with FAT..  YUCK...  for the price we pay there should be more meat.

I NEED MORE than one small ASS scoop each of rice and mac.   They charge 2.99 for extra mac and rice... that's CRAZY!!  talk..

I only visit this place because its right next to blockbuster and closer  to me than Hawaiian Drive in over in Daly City.
author: Simon L.

description:
Forget mcdonald and eat here instead!

If you like something fast and on the go, try their Chicken Mutsubi.
a decent quality food at low price.
author: Scott B.

description:
Don't go to Ono Hawaiian BBQ. THIS PLACE SUCKS!

When this place first opened, it wasn't bad. Over the years, the way the staff prepare the food got greasier and shinier. I've been here a few times, but after last year I don't eat here anymore. I go to the King of Thai across the street. 

I used to order the bbq chicken or the loco moco here. It was decent until the staff changed. The macaroni is shit here. Why? You can taste the spoiled mayo if you really know how to spot it. The celery pieces aren't even crunchy. That means the mac salad is old. 

Overcooked veggies, more grease than the food. If you wring the bread like a sponge, you'll get alot of grease. Great toy if you're really bored. haha
author: Jason C. J.

description:
I was passing on sloat and decided to check it out. First off I had a few large chunks of un-edible beef in my BBQ Beef plate. It was marinated fat or something because it looked and smelled good but I could barley chew it, I almost chocked on a piece! There wasn't much flavor either, it didn't taste very Hawaiian to me. I ate all the cabbage though, it was plain and tasted better than the rest of the food! Next time I will drive to Hawaiian Drive In on Mission St for some real Hawaiian FOOD!

1 Star for the soda and cabbage.
author: Yosof R.

description:
Food = okay.  A tad on the greasy side but still good.  I love their macaroni salad.

Service = fast

Seating = okay

Better to do take out, and just order the mini-meals, unless you really want a gut-buster for lunch/dinner.

Prices = good.  They do take credit cards too.
author: Fannie S.

description:
MEAT MEAT MEAT. I love it. Sometimes my family would order some of this stuff to go and I would always be excited.

Their meat is actually good. The short ribs are small but you get about two in one slab. Not extremely tender. It's kind of chewy but tasty. The chicken katsu is alright. Breaded just enough and you get a lot of meat. 

I also really enjoy their macaroni salad. Full of mayo, which I usually don't like, but it's so good. Little bits of carrot and chunks of potatoes. Probably infused with massive amounts of fat but who cares. Just eat it and be amazed! 

I haven't had it in a while but I just remember always looking forward to my uncle coming back home with the boxes of, literally, just meat. If you're craving for some carnivore action, try here. You probably won't be unsatisfied. Enough to end your animalistic habits and maybe even your heart!
author: robin w.

description:
Items I've tried and liked:

Chicken Katsu
BBQ Chicken
Island Curry Chicken
Kalua Pork

All dishes come with 2 scoops of rice, 1 scoop of macaroni salad and cabbage.

Be sure to phone in your order or you'll be waiting for a while for them to prepare your food.
author: Jo S.

description:
Originally, I was planning on getting the mini meal, but instead, I got #3 (chicken combo meal--which includes chicken bbq and chicken katsu) because I figured I can save the rest for some other meals. The food was ready in like TWO minutes, so fast that it was even a little fishy for me haha. But all good.

Got home, and my two sisters and I started digging in and sharing the plate. We finished the macaroni salad and the rice and a few pieces of chicken, but there is still SO MUCH LEFT!! And we are pretty big eaters. God, their portion size is HUGEEEEEEE. Right now, I still have enough bbq chicken to last me for probably another two meals. Right on!! 

And the food is tasty too.
author: Diana L.

description:
It smells really good everytime I pass by there.  It's a whole lot of BBQ-grillin' but it's a place that sells heart-attack specials.  Mayo-macaroni salad, rice, and slabs and slabs of meats.  Chicken, beef you name it.  Big portions enough to feed 2.  

If you can't resist the smell and need to try some of their stuff, order the Mini size, or if there are 2 of ya, order 1 regular meal and split it.  It's really enough to get you filled.
author: Jannie Q.

description:
The one in Colma is more spacious than this one but that's probably because this is ini SF.
Long time ago they had delicious garlic shrimp which was always be my choice each time I went to Ono.
Now they only have crispy shrimp. The shrimp is butterflied to shape like an "O"  then breaded and fried.
The fried crispy shrimp was tough. The shrimp meat inside was not juice, tasted old.
The BBQ beef was tasty although it had quite a lot of gristle.
The macaroni salad was good with a hint of tuna.
Steam cabbage, I suppose, served as filler, but quite tasty as well.
author: H M.

description:
Ono Hawaiian BBQ. You are truly a rip off.

I came here for the very 1st time and it will also be my last time. The food here clearly smells good, but the taste doesn't live up to the smell. The portion is SO tiny! I ordered the BBQ short ribs, and all I got were basically bones of the short ribs, where the meat man?!?! The 2 scoop of rice and macaroni salad were super skimpy. The spam musuabi were not good, not enough sauce between the spam and rice. This meal was major disappointment. 

I'll drive the extra mile to L&L in daly city where they serve way better quality of food for the same price.
author: Jenny G.

description:
Quick Tip: It's crowded here after school (3pm).

Sister and I were hungry after a long day and needed a quick meal because I was heading out to one of my friend's graduation (Dan's!), but was really hungry.

This restaurant was close by to her apartment, and we decided to try it out. It's comparable to Hawaiian Drive-Inn or L&L, so if you are in the area it's good to try.

The restaurant is a little bit small, especially around the late afternoon when all the students flood to probably to one of the most inexpensive places in the plaza. If you find a seat, take it...but be aware of the annoying banter between adolescents discussing their perils of high school and family life.

The food is great. I loved he BBQ Chicken, and my sister was quite impressed with the BBQ Rib (I think it was the rib?). We've gone back a couple of times, and are always pleased with our purchase. We're just always worried about whether or not we will get a table.

Nice workers, though :)
author: J D.

description: The BBQ Beef was pretty tasty. Hawaiian BBQ chicken surprisingly a bit dry. The kalbi short ribs were just a disgrace. Nothing but a bunch of fat on the bones. No meat in sight. The mac salads are too heavy on the mayo. The combos do provide filling meals, but leave much to be desired. There's so much potential in a styrofoam container that weighs 3 pounds with meat, rice, and macaroni salad!
author: Dan K.

description:
Its ok...better than most places in the city...

I usually come here after practice or if i am near by and craving hawaiian...

portions are small...really expensive for the food and they are slow making the food...ESPECIALLY during lunch...

I wasn't in a big rush...but i dislike waiting...i ordered a chicken katsu with curry....i guess the kitchen was backed up...there were at least 8 people who got their food before me...but there were only a couple people in the restaurant.....Its ridiculous price for the amount of macaroni
author: Brendan L.

description: I was driving around looking for something to eat and saw Ono, so I thought I would pop in.  So I unsure of what I wanted to eat so i just got the BBQ Musubi and it was good.  The meat was tender and I didnt need a knife to break the musubi apart.  Maybe next time I'll get that as a mini rice plate
author: Donovan R.

description: Fast and good, can't really go wrong with that. My go-to dish is the Kalbi short ribs. I've tried the chicken katsu and the other BBQ stuff but none of them are as good as the short ribs. They've changed up how they do the macaroni salad. I hated the salad before and now it's tolerable, not as rubbery and plastic-flavored. Would totally love it more if they did coleslaw or something. It's hard to resist the place when it smells so good every time you pass it.
author: Jo T.

description:
My boyfriend likes coming here cause it is right next to gamestop. The food her is just like the Hawaiian Drive In on Noriega, so just go look at my review from there. I never tried the bbq stuff from here before, so ignore that when you are reading my review from Hawaiian Drive In.

The place though, is more attractive and looks cleaner (don't know if it really is.) Hate the parking here though.... the cars are sooo close together.... and sometimes there are no parking.... and I have to make a big circle to get back into the plaza.
author: Alicia W.

description:
I like this place cuz its fast, good, cheap, and close my house if I'm ever craving hawaiian bbq. 

Their bbq chicken is moist, flavorful. Their macaroni salad is yummy too!
author: Jean T.

description:
Ono's is a joint for those who have an undiscriminating love for Hawaiian barbecue, those who have run out of gas and cannot drive any further, and those who do not have enough energy to walk to another store.

I have had the Chicken Combo and Hawaiian Bbq Mix a few times.  The chicken katsu always has equal amounts of breading and meat, which means it has way too much breading.  The other meats are usually burnt more than necessary.  The macaroni salad tastes like Elmer's glue.

I would avoid Ono's if I were not desperate.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Customers are REALLY rude here..how would i rate on that....
I usually despise hawaiian food anyway..idk why i came here yesterday..
spam musubis is the only thing thats good. 

So my mom and i were JUST about to sit down at this table, and these other people who were leaving points out to these kids near the door who had JUST come in, and said to us. "i think they were trying to sit here".....
um, we ALREADY sat down, and they JUST walked in the door...wteff?  and is it really your place to say something? PLUSSS there are plenty of other seats everywhere!

They should probably set the tables up better here too, its a mess.
+ for coupon for nubi 
+ the teriyaki sauce on the musubis were just right.
author: kim w.

description:
I ordered the BBQ chicken plate. The combination of the rice, macaroni and BBQ chicken sent me to heaven. The chicken tastes amazing here. I wish I could make it like that at home. 

One of my favorite meals for sure.
author: Tim M.

description:
Yummy as usual =)

I usually got the ribs but I tried the bbq chicken (#1) instead this time. Soooo good. I still love the macaroni salad! I only took away 1 star because the drinks are bought seperately =(
author: Sandy F.

description:
I think the food is good but a bit on the pricey side.  Its comfort food, dont expect too much and you'll be fine.  My friends and I came here often when they first opened but now go only sparingly cus, well, its not that healthy and there are too many other eateries for me to try in the Bay.  

Service here is usually fine and a couple times now they've made me a Chicken Katsu musubi (not on menu) when I asked for it.  I give the staff props for doing that.

I also really like their location here....I like sitting outside watching peeps walk by and feeling the breeze.
author: Gilbert C.

description: Hmm... Food came out surprisingly too quick... Must've cooked the chicken katsu beforehand to better prepare for the lunch rush. Though, the portions I felt were smaller... And sauces (katsu and teriyaki) were cold and not warm)... And the space is very cozy, especially during lunch rushes and dinner! Anyhow, their new(er) aloha plates come with your choice of meat and rice, and a side of salad. I've had this at they locations before but they also skimped out on the sauce on my salad! I know, it's a salad and it's supposed to be healthier, but it's yummy!!! (Tubby kid inside of me dances) haha :P I love onos regardless and I will come back because I'm a sucker... And a tubby kid....
author: Ci- Ci H.

description: Ono's seems like either a hit or miss for me each time. I dont like macaroni salad so I ask each time for it to be replaced by rice. 50/50 they mess up the order and forget to  do that. Overall the food here is also a hit or miss, Very delicious when its a hit , not the best when its a miss. Beef , Chicken , and Ribs are delicious when its not burnt! No one likes burnt food! Katsu is good when its not over fried here. I also like the curry here , its only 85 cents and its delicious over rice or even on musubi!
author: Jeffrey T.

description:
Pescetarians beware: there's chicken in the "Seafood Mix."

The mahi-mahi and shrimp were alright, though I think other places (L&L) do them better and also have a much wider seafood selection.
author: Aaron A.

description:
The chicken Katsu is amazing, YUM!

I'm taking off one star because the food took forever!  I ordered at 11am and didn't get my food until 11:20 :(  For fast food, that is way too long!

Learn from my mistake and call ahead to preorder.
author: L C.

description:
This is my default cheap dinner place. I come here whenever I have no other place to go and am eating alone. The staff personalities are a hit or miss. Some people won't even say hello while others will take your order with a smile. But since it's pretty much a fast food joint, you're here for the food - not the service. 

The food is great! Portions are worth the price and that's why I keep coming back. If they offered anything less, I'd probably hit up the Quiznos next door every now and again. 

Other than the now-getting-really-old-and-dirty chairs, the place is fairly clean. Outdoor seating is a great option on those sunny days. I've never had a problem parking either.
author: Brian Q.

description: Took 15 minutes for 2 orders of spam misubi. It was good, but by the time I got it, it was cold.
author: Nancy W.

description:
Food was OK, the service SUCKED!

Food: Really nice and juicy, well marinated.  Mac salad is pretty good at this place.  The fried shrimps and the fish are better than most places I've been to. 

Service: Boooooo!  No hi, no thank you, no goodbye.  They didn't even bother to call my number.  They just placed it on the counter and I waited 20 minutes.  Why bother to put a tip jar out?
author: Chai S.

description:
Kinda pricey for high school lunch, but if you order all rice in the mini meal it's pretty filling.

Also, you can put in your order by phone and have it be done when you get there -- very convenient for Lowelites walking over.
author: Elena C.

description: 10 minutes? Seriously? I guess I should be happy that they're actually "cooking" stuff to order. But if I'm waiting 10 minutes for a meal, I don't want it to be Hawaiian fast food. But even when you do get your food, it's not better than L&L or Hawaiian Drive Inn. Damn, I miss the Hukilau on Masonic.
author: eric f.

description: I come here pretty often. The food is alright. Shrimp and beef is actually really nice. Just don't eat the macaroni salad plain, because that gave me a big stomach ache
author: Reginald W.

description: They took loco moco off the menu. How can you call yourself Hawaiian with out offering loco moco. I will not be back, wanna-be HI food is now even worse.
author: Michael V.

description:
Quit yo jibba jabba, Mr. T says pity the fool who don't like a heap 'o meat!

If you gave this place less than 5 stars, you're ordering the wrong damn thing.  I've eaten here at least 40 times over last few years, and they are SUPER consistent when it comes to grilled meats.  Props to the kitchen.

Next time, you should order this if you want great meal:
- island caesar salad
- chicken and beef combo 
- kalbi short ribs
- crispy shrimp (katsu sauce)

And bring yo wallet, fool! Mr. T don't like no free loader. $28 for all this?  You don't need to be on A-Team to eat good!  Ahhhh....
author: Jason Y.

description:
Over cooked copy of L&L (which is sorta like saying it's a copy of a fax)

reserve for feeding in a pinch...or if you have kids (or neices/nephews)
author: Ed F.

description:
OKAY. 

Ben likes to eat Ono's but that might change when I bring him to some other Hawaiian Joints. Ono's is good for fast food. He likes his katsu chicken so it works well for us. I am not a fan of their macaroni. It taste funny to me and makes me make a funny face. I like how neatly their condiments are arranged though and they get the job done on a sunny afternoon of sloat shopping.
author: Amy S.

description:
The healthy (at least as advertised) lemon pepper chicken was actually pretty good, and they give you a pretty generous portion. But I can't give more than one star to a place that packs ALL their orders - eat in AND takeout - in landfill ready containers. I won't even mention the massive mound of plastic bags ready to put those takeout orders in. Oh wait, I did.

Earth to Ono - we've got this little green movement going on, gonna need everyone to pitch in, how about you not create more trash than necessary, especially when people are eating AT your establishment.

Food - Four stars.
Environmental stewardship - Negative stars.
author: Jason B.

description:
There is so much right about this place: delicious grilled chicken, served by default with plain rice and veggies (yummy and healthy!); located right by the zoo; low prices.  But the service is unbearable.  They are seriously upset every time a customer comes through the door.  So I'm torn about returning.  The tie-breaker is the delicious chicken, since it's the only chicken B has ever loved, and even as I'm remembering the dirty restaurant and angry staff, I still kind of want to go get a to-go order.

High chairs?  Nope
Changing tables?  No way
Stroller-friendly?  Not particularly, but you could probably find a place to put it.
Noise level?  It's a small space, so not too bad.
General baby-friendliness?  They're not unfriendly to babies so much as they are unfriendly to everyone.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
This place was really good when they started out a couple of years ago, but lately it's been heading down hill. Trying to get the most out of their money, leads to poor food quality.  I'm not one that rates spam and on her.. to eat list, and the katsu is fairly good, but the portion sizes have greatly dwindled in the last year or so.  

Overcooked soggy veggies are a no-go, & there is so much MSG in the food you can swim in it!

Just FYI for all you veggie-only eaters,  the mac salad taste funny because it has TUNA in it.  The Veggie noodle soup is cooked in chicken broth... and why are you eating at a BBQ place to start with?

Just don't go here.
author: Mel H.

description:
Bah, today I made a mistake and ordered a burger here. What's wrong with me? If I wanted a fast food burger, why didn't I walk my butt over to Arbys? (burn some calories too for that matter!) 

I had the chicken burger. Yuck, yuck, yuck. Mayo on BOTH sides of the bun? Are you trying to give this girl a heart attack? Good thing there was a lot of droopy lettuce to wipe the mayo off with! 

Two slices of cheese? Did I ask for cheese? Did you offer? Was it anywhere on the menu that there was cheese inside? No? Then keep this poorly produced American-cheese to your selves! 


FYI, for a chicken burger they just use two slices of BBQ chicken (on any entree plate) and put it in between two buns, onion, lettuce, tomato & two slices of cheese. Wish someone told me sooner. 

At least it was big. 

...that's what she said
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
We were zipping down Sloat toward the beach and I remembered that there was an Arby's in this strip mall.  My driving companion saw the sign for Ono and we went in there to get a snack for her because she....*doesn't understand* Arby's....

Macaroni salad is less of a wet mayo mess than every other Hawaiian BBQ place I've been to and it quite nice!

The crab langoons seem like they are probably cooked from frozen and not made in house, but are somehow better than any I think I've ever had!

Rest of the menu looks pretty good and the place was jammed with anxious/happy/hungry looking people at 4:30pm on a Friday and I never made it into the Arby's, so that must be saying something!
author: Max I.

description: WTF!! No more loco moco! Portions are skimpy too. Never going back to this location.
author: Joshua L.

description: I came here for lunch on a whim during this MLK holiday. I ordered their kalbi short rib and found it to be absolutely great. Very tasty and tender. I think it's definitely better than that at Sorabol in Stonestown, the one other place where I go for Korean short ribs. The price is definitely better also for approximately the same amount of meat.
author: H K.

description:
Sooo disappointed.  I like getting koula pork at hawaiian places since it is something you don't find other places.  The meat was tender but the flavor was way off.  Tasted way overly salted.  It also had huge globs of fat all over it.  Now I can't get the bad taste out of my mouth.

The portions are quite large, but I would prefer less food for a cheaper price.  Koula pork and a drink came out to $10, and considering I only had a few bites of the meat, it seemed like a lot pay.  I know they have "mini meals" but the pork wasn't part of that option.  

So much for convenience...I won't be going back to Ono even in a pinch!
author: Corrie F.

description:
Updated 3/19, nearly a year after my initial review. 

The food isn't CCS (Cheap Chinese Shit) [tm Nobu.] It's actually quite expensive. But their use of cheap crap puts them in the CCS category. Since in SF there's no more Styrofoam containers, some restaurants have begun using recycled paper containers and others have gone for the thin plastic(recyclable) containers. 

I'm not sure how they think that a hamburger steak (hamburger with gravy on it or Salisbury steak for you white folks) or a Loco Moco (same but with a sunny side up or over EASY egg on it) would be acceptable in a paper container. Or a teriyaki chicken as they serve it with sauce, will not bleed through the paper.

It sucks because now there's a jumbled SOGGY FXXXN MESS of food in a plastic bag mixed with recycled paper. 

ORIGAMI CRANES made of construction paper woulda been cheaper and prettier! Hawaiian Drive in changed to the plastic containers shortly after discovering that the paper ones sucked. 

It sucks even more because my Loco Moco's eggs were over-HARD. Never heard of over-hard? Me neither. I had to look it up. Wiki says that it's over-easy that's been cooked too long. WHERE THERE IS NO RUNNY YOLK!!! 

Perhaps you CCS Mofos don't get the point of a Loco Moco. The yolk is SUPPOSED TO mix with the gravy. I didn't just pay a dollar more for two over fried eggs. 

The teriyaki chicken is more like a crappy Shoyu Chicken. In my country (the Sovereign Nation of Hawaii), teriyaki chicken does not swim in a watered down sauce. 

Aren't there laws about accurate labels on food? 

Hawaiian food (healthy or not) is being severely misrepresented here. All previous 3 stars have been retracted.

edit: Thanks to Berna Diva, I was reminded of 'Hawaii '78' made popular by Brudda Iz. 

UA MAU KE EA O KA 'AINA I KA PONO O HAWAI'I

Roughly translated :"The life (sovereignty) of the land is perpetuated in (by) righteousness"

If just for a day our king and queen
would visit all these islands and saw everything
How would they feel 'bout the changing of our land
Could you just imagine if they were around
and saw highways on their sacred grounds
How would they feel if they 'bout this modern city life

Tears would come from each others eyes as
they would stop to realize
that our people are in great, great danger now

How would they feel
would their smiles be content
rather then cry
cry for the gods, cry for the people
cry for the lands that were taken away
and in it you'll find Hawaii

Could you just imagine if they came back
and saw traffic lights and railroad tracks
How would they feel about this modern city life
Tears would come from each others eyes as
they would stop to realize
that our land is in great, great danger now

All of the fighting that the king had done
to conquer all these islands
now there's condominiums
How would he feel if saw Hawaii now

How would he feel
would his smiles be content
rather then cry
cry for the gods, cry for the people
cry for the lands that were taken away
and in it you'll find Hawaii

UA MAU KE EA O KA 'AINA I KA PONO O HAWAI'I 

--- original review 04/18/2007 --- 
The first time i ate here, I thought that the food didn't justify the pricing. I have been back several times more out of convenience than anything else.

Earlier this week, I bought lunch here. I stood in line with the HS kids..I got my order and filled my drink cup. I went back to work and found that there were no utensils!Why would they put a napkin in the bag and not utensils?

So i didn't eat until much later, when I could get to utensils and after the food was cold. The quality and taste of the food was much better than all of my previous experiences. But I was very unhappy about not having even a fork to eat with.
author: Kevo M.

description:
As we drove our Mercedes C230 back up the Pacific Coast Highway, I was suddenly hit with a craving for Hawaiian food.* 

We pulled into the Ono on Sloat Boulevard and ordered 2 Hawaiian BBQ Mix plates and 2 small sodas, for $20.57.  

The BBQ Mix had one scoop macaroni, one scoop rice, BBQ chicken, BBQ beef, and kalbi short ribs.  Mmm... meat, meat, and meat!  

I'm not sure what island Ono is from.  They were playing Jamaican reggae in the dining area and Mexican cowboy music in the kitchen.  

---------------
*At the time we were passing an L&L in Pacifica.
author: David D.

description:
meat....good
more meat.... goooooood
MORE MEAT!!!!!!!!!!!!............GOOOOOOOOOOOOOOODDDDD

spam!!?!?!???!??!.............GOOOOOOOOOODER

more spam!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!......................... GOOOOOOOOOOOODEST game over.

bring your own heart surgeon.
author: Euge L.

description:
If you're looking for comfort food that's different from your normal mash potatoes and steak, come here!! 

I love everything on their menu from the spam musubi to the chicken combo (I usually get this) to their Island mix. What I love most is their macaroni. I'm not sure why, but I can't get enough of the macaroni + rice together. Their kalua pork is also really delicious. It's not on their "combo" menu with the pictures but definitely worth it! 

I took one star off because of the greasiness that can sometimes plague the food. I guess it depends who cooks back there, but sometimes the food is more greasy than usual. It's particularly unhealthy to eat here so I try to only eat here once every couple months. I really enjoy eating here though, a lot of food for the money and it's tasty too!
author: Christina B.

description:
This is comfort food in my opinion. Portions are usually pretty big (for a regular size entree).

I got the Island Curry Chicken entree with the usual mac salad. I always tell myself not to get a double scope of the mac salad, but I always cave in. I hate to say it, but it's pretty addictive. The chicken was not bad, a little over cooked. Rice was okay.

The wait was a bit long, but then again, there was a group of kids before me. The staff is comprised of high school kids, so don't expect anything great from them.
author: Tim S.

description:
Keys to having a successful lunch or dinner at Ono Hawaiian Grill in Lakeshore Plaza

1) Don't park anywhere near the restaurant. If you do, expect have car scratches, bumps or an accident
2) Call in to order. Orders take 15 mins on Friday nights! OMG, the world is going to end
3) Fill up on free teriyaki and katsu sauce. it's complimentary, so why not stalk up like the world is going to end? 
4) Take it to go. Never. Eat. Inside. Period. The place is too small and you'll find yourself eatting so fast.
5) There is no restroom.
author: Wilson L.

description:
lots of parking in the lot near lucky.

i've been here many times.  well, many times before i tried the ORIGINAL company that I go to more(i do not like to post competitors names)

I've had the hamburger which i like to get if i'm hoping for something better than Mickey D's(really a competitor?) and don't want to go to a restaurant and pay 10 dollars for a supposedly gourmet burger.

I've also had the chicken katsu which I love where ever i go to get it.  This one is good.  I just think one company does it THE BEST.  This place is good and as all Hawaiian Places i've been to, you can choose a mini, or a regular.  Both sizes as USUAL are worth the price.

I've also had the Curry Flavor.

The price is a little bit higher than the competitors.  Also, one competitor actually makes EVERYTHING perfect.  This place is VERY GOOD.  It just isn't better....or cheaper.
author: Bing D.

description:
I tot it was ok at first when i heard this place,i was really excited to try it,although when i went inside to try there chiken katsu,omg i was really upset i don't like it at all,its cooked well...

To be honest if you are at Blockbuster renting a movie you can probably smell this place upon arrival....

I saw one time one of there employee forgot to washed his hands after touching his face...After that,my man and i stop going there...
author: janelle t.

description:
The price is a little more than L&L's and the portions are smaller. Food is decent but I think I still prefer L&L more. 

Don't know what to order? You can never go wrong with BBQ Chicken

Not that hungry but still want to eat? Go for the mini combos $4.99, Comes with meat, rice, cabbage, and macaroni salad. Carbs and protein all in one box! Wash it down with water if you feel guilty eating it afterward. If you feel like adding more calories, get a can of their Hawaiian can drinks because they are awesome! 

They also have soup noodles and musubis.
author: Tracy A.

description:
I drove across town (and back) in rush hour traffic just to get some Ono tonight.  Looove the Hawaiian barbecue mix: a combination with barbecued beef, chicken, and kalbi short ribs with rice, cabbage, and macaroni salad.  I eat it with a little teryaki sauce and sriracha.  The portions on the combos are huge (leftovers!), but they also have a selection of smaller meals.  A few other reviewers have mentioned that the parking situation is difficult, and I have to say I disagree.  The place is attached to a gigantic supermarket parking lot, and parking there is less of a hassle than pretty much any other place I've eaten at in the city, including my own apartment.

Minus one point because of the trek that it takes to get there.
author: Melissa G.

description:
I try to avoid it because eating it  makes me feel like I'm going to die from clogged arteries.

But right now, I think I'm willing to suffer the consequences.

Every time I drive by Sloat I can smell their cooking grease. It spreads in the air like skunk and KFC... Is that bad?
author: Nance W.

description:
I thought it was okay.  I ordered the 'lots o meat' plate and had lots of meat.  Not a lot of rice, but that's okay with me.  I dont' like the macaroni salad but its fine since they don't give you much of that either.  The ribs were a bit fatty, but eh.  I liked the beef the most.

The end
author: Duckie A.

description:
call your order in and avoid the lines and the wait!
Order the Maui Pineapple Chicken as opposed to the katsu, it's the same thing except the sauce is tastier. Definitely better than L&L and Hawaiian Drive In. The mac salad is almost up to par with the plate lunch joints in the islands!
author: Dina V.

description: I came here just to pick up a snack. I was in a rush. Cause I was waiting for the bus and he bus was coming in 10 minutes. So I was waiting in line and this lady can't decided what to get. But when she finally decided. I ordered and the order came pretty fast. Plus it's only $3 for spam misubi. I just wanna say thanks for making the spam misubi as fast as you guys can.
author: M L.

description:
Food is cool.  But to me value is not there.  I guess that's what happens if you try L&L and some of the others like Hawaiian Drive In and Hawaiian Walk In first....  

I'd rather pay less and get more.  Unless Ono's food is much, much better.  And to me, they are pretty close...  

I did hear they offer coupons once in a while so for those who can get their hands on some, it may be well worth it here...
author: Mark W.

description: Never been to Hawaii so I cannot say if it is authentic tasting.  It seems the first time I tried this place I thought it was just OK.  I went back a few weeks ago and it was good.  I had the seafood combo.  But this last time I went back I had the chicken combo.  My toddler had some of my Katsu chicken and it seemed neither of us liked it.  My wife liked the seafood combo I recommended and it was plenty of food for her.  By the time I got home I realized that this was a $20 colon cleanse.  Since I have no desire to ever go to Hawaii,  I guess I will never have a strong comparison but I doubt Hawaiian food is supposed to make you sick.  It could have had something to do with the macaroni salad side they serve.  It seemed to be a sub standard temperature, but maybe I am a snob for liking my macaroni salad COLD!!!!
author: Dennis O.

description: Greasy.. beef is full of fats and little meat... so heavy and not worth gaining an extra couple pounds for.. don't go here unless you're a fatso..
author: Sean P.

description:
I only had the spam musubi....

Thumbs up on the slight crispy pan-friedness of the spam.
Thumbs down on putting teriyaki in it!!!!
author: Sabrina L.

description:
I adore this hidey-hole Hawaiian BBQ joint in the Parkside.  They serve up mass quantities of food for a reasonable price.  Most people can't finish one of their plate lunches, but I sure can.  I do feel stuffed after eating one though.

They take call-in orders and also offer a take-out catering menu.  Insanely cheap catering menu; fed me, all my co-workers and tons left for leftovers for Christmas, all for only $80, with tax included.

Probably one of the best Hawaiian joints around.  Check them out for yourself!!
author: Aileen B.

description:
I've had a few lunches here before with some satisfaction but today was not good.

Ok so it's possible it was just me but I had lunch there today and I've been having projectile everything for the last few hours.  I didn't have much else to eat today.  Nothing impresses your co-workers like kneeling in front of the toilet in the office bathroom (which in itself will make you sick).  I would have gone home but I didn't feel like I could make it.  I waited until 8 but had to pull over anyway.  Watch out if you're walking down Oshaunassy blvd.
author: Scott S.

description: I think this Ono Hawaii BBQ is best around the bay area..  At least they give you a smile after you order.
author: Erica T.

description:
Nom nom nom.

I have eaten here a few times, but for some reason - today, the food tasted extraordinary. I made the perfect bite: a juicy, yet oily piece of chicken, with a little bit of rice, and macaroni salad... yum.

...Is it just me, or are the scoops of rice and macaroni salad getting smaller? Two scoops of rice is equivalent to what one scoop of rice used to be! Pft. Suckas.
author: Annie S.

description:
This place is soooooo Ono! Yum!
I always get the Kahlua Pork. Very Tasty. The Spam Musubi and the Hawaiian Sun Drinks brought tears to my eye! I felt like I was back in Hawaii.
The Chicken Katsu & Teriyaki are good too. But dont EVER get the Loco Moco...ew....you'll regret it.
You get a lot of food for a good price! 
Shaka Bradah!  Haha.
author: Judith F.

description:
Good Hawaiian food, kind of slow on bringing it out.

It's no joke that to read the menu you practically have to be behind the counter. I don't know who designed the store, but you are better off looking at the menu on the website ahead of time.

The portions are huge. They have a little section (with less items) available if you want to order enough food for one average person. They have all the usual things you'd expect, including Hawaiian Sun drinks and so on.

There are about 8 little tables, most will be smashed together. Eating there would be ok except for the flies. Parking could be tough at certain times, even though it's in a strip mall.
author: Andrew M.

description:
The best Mahi Mahi of all Hawaiian spots in San Francisco!

I was excited when Ono opened up by my parents' house a while back.  I ordered takeout expecting to have the standard lightly-battered, deep-fried, fairly tasteless Mahi Mahi as served at other Hawaiian places.

WOW, shocker!  Their Mahi Mahi was SCRUM-DI-TALLY TASTY!!!  Crunchy panko breading instead of flour and fresh, flaky, moist fish.  But the best part was salted, spicy ginger flavor.  It was really good!

Now, I really don't have high expectations of fast-food places bc they are what they.  I thought that maybe my dining delight was perhaps a lucky fluke.  However, I've been back several times and it has been consistently good.

Mahalo, Ono.

(4 stars fo' da pish)
author: michelle s.

description:
Didn't have time to drive to San Bruno for L & L, so ended up here.  Unlike L&L, you can pay with a credit card, but they only offer the Kalua pig in the regular sized meal.  This sucked since we weren't that hungry, and craved Kalua pig.  I ended up having the BBQ chicken mini meal and was disappointed with the overall taste of the chicken..a bit fibrous and rubbery... eeek!
I also thought they skimped on the rice and mac salad.  It was pretty sad, since I remembered the portions being more generous.
author: Kat L.

description: the kaluha pork was dry and the cabbage was raw. L & L is 10 minutes away on Mission St. in Daly City. i give Ono two stars because the spam musubi is edible and the katsu is fair. should be renamed Oh, no!
author: Jeff W.

description:
My boyfriend and I expected no harm going into this location thinking that it should be comparable to other hawaiin restaurants such as 88rice bowl or L&L. It was comparable but in a bad way. Ono Hawaiin had about the same entrees (katsu, bbq, masubi) but it tasted old and lacked a lot of quality. 

On top of the bad food, the cashier tried to charge me twice for the same order... never going there again and I advise other people to give another restaurant a try.
author: Jason S.

description:
I like their food, but wish they were open earlier for a meal to take with me for the free Stern Grove summer concerts.

Mmm Spam musubi.

I think they'd do pretty good business if they opened a bit earlier for the Stern Grove-ites and let them know they were opened for picnic-ables.
author: Cathy K.

description:
Back in the days of my youth, I use to be able to eat a lot without feeling the consequences (ill, bloatedness, not feeling the embarrassment of eating like a pig, etc.) Over the years, though, I've cut back, both subconsciously and intentionally.

Ono Hawaiian BBQ is probably the latest of reasons for me to actually eat less.

I mean, if a 'normal' helping of Hawaiian food is enough food to make me want to never ever eat in my lifetime, then Ono has the power.

The helpings make McDonald's extinct Super Sizing look like a regular meal. Anyone who eats a regular meal without feeling like a fatass is either a person with a very healthy metabolism system, or an unapologetic fatass. The 'mini' meal is just fine with me... and has probably taught me in general to order less and not regret it after the meal.

The food in general is okay for the most part... sometimes greasy... maybe because of the cholesterol and fat or something. (I swear I'm not a health nut.)

The service is okay. It's what you would expect from a bunch of high schoolers behind a fast food counter. The spacing is decent for the small place... it's never been packed whenever I've wanted to sit down.

Probably the best part about the place is that it's close to Gamestop and Lucky's and Blockbuster. That and the Spam musubis are usually great... so is the BBQ Chicken mini meal. Too bad they don't have kalua pork in mini meal form, though. If that were the case, I'd give this place an easy four stars.

If you want to feel full after a meal... and possibly TOO full... this place is the best... well, for being cheap and close to places I'd normally go to.
author: Chris S.

description: Spam masubi...not bad.  For two of them..costs somewhere around $3.59?  I think a little over-priced.  Grab a seat outside...it's nice if the sun is out.
author: B C.

description:
So I was craving Hawaiian food today. I've eaten here once before and thought it was terrible. My bf's family is from Hawaii so I know what good hawaiian food should taste like and this isn't it - flavorless kalua pig, too much mayo in the mac salad. But I digress.....I was craving Hawaiian food and had just come out of Tully's with my latte for the day. I figured maybe we'll try them again..they've been open for awhile and maybe got their act together. As soon as I walked to the doorway all I smelled was grease, grease, grease. No way was I going to eat here. We got in the car and the bf said "you should have seen the look on your face when you walked in"

Next time I'll just drive to L&L in Pacifica.
author: Maria M.

description: There's not too many fast food Hawaiian spots in the city.  I like this place because they're fast, prices are reasonable, and I know what to expect.  this particular location is located in a shopping complex so parking is pretty easy.
author: Ricky M.

description:
So what, yeah, I like meat....and rice...and macaroni salad - all in one sitting. Come to Onos and you'll get a mound of this deliciousness all wrapped up in a plastic container to take and eat in the privacy of your own home. Yes, I'd prefer for perfect strangers to not see me shoveling food in my mouth at 99 miles per minute (yeah, I give up on the chopsticks and go for the fork or hands ;) ).

If you're not familiar with Hawaiian BBQ but like grilled asian foods, you'll be just fine here. Try the BBQ chicken or even better, a BBQ mixed plate and you'll get a lil of everything. That's the way I do it! 

A box of meat and rice for $6.50. Sold!
author: Deann M.

description:
I can't even think about having Ono ever again. The thought of it just makes me lose my appetite & I automatically get a full stomach.

It's not even because the food was nasty. I just got sick of it really quickly for some reason. There wasn't anything spcial about it. I always ordered the Chicken Katsu & at first, it was heavenly. Had it a few more times and that was it. They give a lot of chicken, but not enough rice. And the macaroni salad is just weird. 

I'm sure there's better Hawaiian Bbq places elsewhere.
author: Steph W.

description:
I had the BBQ Chicken plate and it came with rice and some sort of macaroni salad.I didn't think the chicken tasted all that well and I was starving.I thought the rice and macaroni salad tasted ok,but didn't eat much of the chicken.

To be honest if you are at Blockbuster renting a movie you can probably smell this place upon arrival.I wouldn't say that I would not come back here because it was hard for me to order in the first place.Everything looked tasty,well in the display of pictures.

Seafood Mix,Mahi-Mahi and Garlic Shrimp meals sounds good.
author: Dani D.

description:
I won't bother next time.

I'd advise you not to either. There'd have to be a major food crisis to get me to burn my money again... I was stuck in Lakeshore Plaza and hungry, that's my excuse... 

I had the Mahi Mahi rice plate, t'was a l lot-o-MAYO salad, white rice, and tasteless breaded white fish. The fish didn't come with any sauce what-so-ever? I'll pass it next time.
author: tim y.

description:
No more all you can pump katsu sauce. With gas no longer at 4 dollars this place is a major PASS. I'd rather drive to san bruno, hell even millbrae, for L&L. 

Does anyone actually eat that soggy steamed cabbage crap they put on the bottom of the meat? By the time I get the plate home it turns into this soupy mixture of grease, water, and sauce. When I'm done eating I actually have to drain all that crap out before tossing the box or risk having it leak out of the trash bin. TERRIBLE.
author: Wes C.

description: Worst food in the WORLD! It's better to get frozen microwavable food than buying this junk.
author: Ronnel C.

description:
Food's OK, but geez, If I'm going to eat in, at least give me a real plate!

too mcuh rice, the short ribs were a bit grisly and tough, but my kids enjoyed the teriyaki chicken.

And what's up with all that cabbage?

Next time, I'll do take out so I can eat off real plates at home.
author: Anita R.

description:
We can't imagine giving Hawaiian BBQ higher than three stars.  HaBBQ is just too dangerous to endorse as a fully balanced meal.  We're sorry.

However, for the very occasional guilty pleasure, Ono Hawaiian BBQ is a safe choice.  The BBQ meat is good, but not superb.  We still prefer the slightly stronger spices from LnL.  The mac salad is sometimes too watery.

However, the real reason we cannot give this place three stars like that of its competitors is because this place has no dessert.  Where is the haupia pudding?!
author: Kel S.

description:
I love Hawaiian BBQ, so I was happy to find a place a little closer than Daly City.  While the food is good, it honestly doesn't match up to other places I've tried.  I don't know what it is.  I get the same thing everywhere - hamburger steak.  It's good, but there's something missing.  The macaroni salad is good, but it's not served warm (which I prefer) and again, there's something missing.

For a quick fix when you're in the area, there's nothing wrong with Ono.  It just doesn't blow me away.
author: Denise M.

description: Food is very good. Love their spam musubi and chicken katsu meal.The good thing is u can get as many sauce as you can because the sauce is just at the table/counter. You get a discount to Nubi if you buy something here.
author: Heat L.

description:
Ok. So this place is a chain.

Yes, we know the ppl working  behind the counter probably have never set a foot in Hawaii.

And I've never had REAL Hawaiian food (like actually eat something in Hawaii)

BUT.

The macaroni salad is awesome. Not like... oh mom made this, and I'll eat it awesome.... but more like.... i'll blow up your damn dog with dynamite if I don't get a bite of this delicious side dish kinda awesome. It's SOOOO Good.

The family combo is a good way to test your metal, as it's pretty huge, and definitely worth the bucks if you got like 4 ppl to feed. IF you're not hungry, don't go here... but if you're starving because you had to feed your vegetarian friends around town, and all you could stomach was some kinda hippy pastry with hash on top.... this is the place to be. MEAT. And lots of it.

Parking is alright. Just be wary of the blockbuster vistors who undoubtly double park and block you damn car. CURSES!
author: Clinton L.

description:
When I first heard this place was opening up within a 1/8 mile from my house, I was like, "Fuck Yeah!!!, Chicken Katsu at my convenience!"  I was going bezerk. 

However, I didn't realize that OHG's Katsu would be much grosser than L &L and Hawaiian Drive-Inn's.  Although OHG's Katsu had much larger strips of fried chicken, it was still fatty and slightly pinkish.  Furthermore, their Katsu doesn't deliver that crunch. And if slightly pink chicken ain't gross (and harmful) to you, then I don't know what is.

On the other hand, OHG's BBQ Beef is cut in large pieces and is cooked very soft and tasteful.  Their macaroni is prepared fresh and is not overloaded with mayo.  In addition, OHG wastefully garnishes your plate with boiled cabbage.  What gives!?!

I'm just not a big fan of this place because I could get better and less expensive Hawaiian in Daly City.
author: Eric T.

description:
Two reasons why this place didn't get 4-5 stars:
The costumer service sucks, but you can't expect too much from fast food.
The cooks look miserable, I only hope thier frustrations don't end up on my plate.

The food is tasty and they give you a lot.  If you can ignore the service and angry looking cooks, then this place is pretty good.
author: Mark J.

description: Had the special $6.99 plate with BBQ beef, soda, two scoops rice, steamed cabbage, and a fruit salad.  Everything was great.  The rice was freshly cooked, the beef was tender and enough to satisfy my hunger.  The self-serve teriyaki sauce is lovely.  The fruit salad was beautiful, I think the pineapple was FRESH and not from a can!  Walked in and there was no line, but in a few seconds there were people lined up to the door.  I got in back of the line because I had been reading the menu.  Anyway, the service was so FAST, I was out of there in less than five minutes.  Like they do in Hawaii, I ate it all in the car on the way to the beach, I wasn't driving.  The fruit salad was dessert at the beach on the sand.  Life is good.  Believe it.
author: Rona M.

description:
Heavy on the meat and fair on the starch and carbs

The place is the spot to go if you plan on sharing and order or just really really hungry after a busy day. Inside is a pretty typical fast food joint. Bolted/Bench style seating and a condiments/soda section so you can load up on whatever sauce you might need. To-Go food is boxed up in cardboard food containers, not pretty but it's a little better than Styrofoam.

It's not top end but for under $8.00 I'm not expecting a whole lot more, it's just a good spot to get your grub on.
author: Keith A.

description: Got the chicken katsu and like where's the meat.  Looks like they use a meat slicer to slice it to baloney thickness and a healthy coating of crust.  Been to other Ono's and they're ok.  This one is on my blacklist .   Don't waste your money here.
author: John L.

description: Pretty decent fast food style Hawaiian BBQ place.  The food is pretty good and is nice and cheap.  It's pretty much an L&L's with a different name.  But I like this Ono's because of the cabbage they put under the chicken (seems weird, but that's why I like to go here).  One weak thing about this location, is that they're kinda slow, especially when there's hella school kids there.
author: Tim L.

description:
I don't know about everyone else..but my food was delish! 

I got the chicken combo which was the katsu chicken and bbq chicken...a scoop of rice and their yummy macaroni salad and I was set!

My bf got the seafood combo platter and he agreed it was good!

Service was fast...I'd come back again!
author: Jade B.

description: Decent Hawaiian local style food for being in SF. The mac salad is pretty good, so is the chicken katsu and kalua pig. A bit pricy, but worth it when I need a fix! And they have Hawaiian Sun canned drinks :)
author: Toni Ellen K.

description: I love the macaroni salad, simple, kind of sweet but very good. The last time I was here I wasn't very hungry and decided to try something that looked light and on the healthier side than my usual loco moco hamburger steak with gravy and egg (which is always good, but heavy) i ordered what I though was grilled chicken teriyaki with curry.  But it was actually just chicken teriyaki, the sign was confusing to me for some reason, any ways it had lemon and was suprisingly VERY good, moist and must have been marinating for a while because it had a lot of flavor for white meat.  The portions were large, and I didn't finish it, but normally I would cause I'm such an oinker, but I loved it and would order it again. It's a good deal for what you pay.
author: Charla M.

description:
cheap eats meets hungry stomach

if you are hungry and in the mood for grill meats, this is the place for you!

big portions but the service is really slow because the kitchen is kinda small
author: Carol Y.

description: Great place to take a big group of people, I was excited when I had 8 friends, and had a deal when we order family style. So far I haven't notice any major difference between each Hawaiian spot. but this place is the spot to eat Hawaiian food family style
author: Peter Y.

description:
The restaurant is clean, neat and inviting. Upon entering, you are faced with a brightly colored menu on the wall above the register.  The selection of meats, chicken, and seafood, combos and sides is nearly overwhelming. 

THE MEAL:
With 2 scoops of rice and 1 scoop of macaroni salad, this is a complete meal - and if you're not a total glutton, maybe two. The food comes to you *hot*, so If you're not one for warm macaroni salad, eat it FIRST.

They offer a smaller portion meal, but you are limited to about half a dozen items. Instead of the requisite 2 scoops of rice and 1 of macaroni salad, this portion is limited to one scoop of each and, of course, a smaller portion.

AND, THEY'RE ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY!
I love the fact that San Francisco wants to GREEN this city. The ad campaign, while it can only be explained as San-Francisco-Interesting, is often taken as just another liberal pet project that will eventually peter out. Many like the idea, but few are doing much about making the change. 

Not Ono Hawaiian Grill! I was more than pleased when I received my food in a very recyclable egg-carton-material container.
author: Carrie S.

description:
This is probably my favorite fast food place around.  I call it fast food because i always call in my order ahead of time.  The Hawaiian BBQ beef with no mac salad, just more rice.  And when i get there all i have to do it pay and take my food away.

Half the time its a gigantic serving with a crapload of meat.  The other half they sorta skimp on the size.  Its kind of hit or miss, because I usually go here once a week, and the quality alternates every other time.  Oh well, its not too expensive, and i seem to like it most of the time.
author: Terence P.

description: Food quality is decent for this kind of place - not the best I've tasted and not the worst either.  They offer a coupon  where if you buy one meal and two large drinks you get another meal for half off - not really that great of a deal especially since the drink selection is nothing to write home about.  At the time of our visit the iced tea machine wasn't working right - the black iced tea coming out  was more like water and one of the other teas wasn't dispensing at all.  Turnover is good - they're very busy at dinner time so food is hot and fresh.   My boyfriend asked for all rice in his grill combo (meaning he didn't want the macaroni salad) and they also replaced the cabbage under the meat portion with rice too.  We  asked what happened to the cabbage under the meat and they explained we should have said "no macaroni only " so we'd still get the cabbage.  They were nice though and gave us an extra side of cabbage after that .
author: G. R.

description: Same standard fare served at all the Ono Hawaiian restaurants.
author: C L.

description:
Food is not bad! I always go for the spam masubi and the mini teriyaki chicken plate! 

Parking is not bad either...

Note: I go here if I'm in this area...
author: Marc E.

description: I really love the food here! Simple and delicious! The mahi mahi and the crispy shrimp is wonderful.The macaroni salad goes wonderfully with the thick taste of the katsu. Definitely recommend it for a quick and tastey lunch.
author: Kevin L.

description: Good, consistent Hawaiian BBQ plate lunch meals. Not as good as L&L, but close. Sloat location is better than Serramonte by far (meat quality, less salty, faster service). Can't beat the family meal with coupon for $19.99! I always get the BBQ beef, BBQ chicken, and Mahi Mahi. Kalbi is good too.
author: Nancy F.

description: The food usually takes a good 10 - 15 minutes, but I really enjoy it.  Love the macaroni salad and the BBQ beef.  The chicken is a bit on the greasy side, but still good.  LOVE their spam musubi.  The hot sauce packets they have are amazing.  Never have had a reason to complain about the customer service.  My only complaint is that they close so early.  Rice is good.  Prices are decent too.  I'm a fan, personally.
author: Crystal Z.

description:
I've only ordered take out from here but the Mahi Mahi Burger was quite delicious and huge! It took awhile to get it...I'd say at least 5-6 minutes for my order to come up....
But looking at the menu selection and the portion sizes for the family meal sets...They aren't kidding that it can feed up to 3 people!  Thankfully they offered single serving or mini servings for those of sane eating habits ^_- ...

Parking can be a hassle especially since there's only 1 way out of the lot...you can't go back to the main lot near Albertson once you enter this side lot...kinda like entering Mount Doom...You can't leave the same way you come in.  Lunchtime is especially harrowing as you have to fight the teen lunch crowd that always spring up exactly when you need to order, so try going there before 11:30, you'll have a better chance of ordering/getting your food in a timely manner.
You can eat in a small group on the outside front area...but I don't recommend more than 4 in your group otherwise, it's pretty hard to find tables and chairs.
author: Pauline L.

description: My kids and I were craving a little Hawaiian BBQ and since we drive by this place all the time on our way out of Lucky's we decided to try it.  Turned out to be a big huge mistake.  We ordered barbeque beef, chicken katsu and  barbeque chicken family meal.  When we got home we found shocking, really gross food.  The chicken katsu had two pieces with human hair fried to it which made us wonder what was hiding in the other two main dishes.  We stopped eating right away.  The grease on the cabbage was so gross.  The rice and mac looked were super small scoops like they didn't have enough to make the family meal so they switched to smaller ice cream scoops.  This is not what we were expecting at all.  Horrified we threw out the food and went to Daly City L&L Hawaiian BBQ and got some more food.  In addition to the waste of time, this was a big huge waste of money (over $30.00 for the family meal).  We would have taken this back but the containers were all soggy and not sufficient to hold the food without the food falling out and making things gross in our car.  It is clear these people don't care about quality.  I and my three young ones  will never come back to this Ono's.  My true review is I would really like to give it negative 30 stars for the $30 plus dollars I lost in going to this place.  I hope this was helpful in warning others.
author: Tahiti Lucy B.

description:
When I drop by any of their stores I always order the Spam Musubi or BBQ Chicken Musubi. The Musubi's make perfect snack food when your offroading in the mountains.

But I always order on a weekly basis from these guys to feed my workers. We usually order the Chicken Combo plates. More then enough food on that plate to cure your hunger for sure. Make sure to ask for extra katsu sauce.
author: Masa M.

description:
Ono Hawaiian BBQ is very ONO, especially when you are feeling a chicken katsu and scoop of rice - but when you have the register/server person giving you attitude, it ruins the whole experience. 

How can you tell me that you work at an ONO Hawaiian restaurant, and you don't know what some of the food is...for example, I asked, " Do you have malasadas?" and she looked at me as though I was living on mars, and gave me attitude and was like, " umm, no and proceeded to roll her eyes". What a great way to make you to feel your customers welcome. I give the food a thumbs up, but the cash register/server person, thumbs down!
author: Sean A.

description:
Some people may say that these Hawaiian places are all the same... they are not!  

Personally, compared to L&L - Ono wins hands down.  They're portions seem bigger and the pricing seems cheaper.  Their spam masubi tastes 10 times better.  They are even more pleasant for that matter.  

I alternate between the loco  moco and the chicken katsu but ALWAYS have the spam masubi, two orders even because they're great the day after for a heavy breakfast.  YUM!
author: Patricia G.

description: Worse than L&L this place serves up bland Hawaiian fare. In my opinion typical Hawaiian food is pretty bland to begin with but this place puts it to shame. The katsu was mostly wiggly thigh meat deep fried in poor batter with a watered down katsu sauce. The mac salad was decent but thats not hard to mess up. I would stay away from this place and go for King of Thai friend chicken platter instead. Its right across the street.
author: M K.

description: I ate a few Ono Hawaiian BBQs around the bay area, and this one is got to be one of the worst.  Ordered the BBQ Short Rib: undercooked in one side and overcooked on the other, no veggies, rice was hard (not fresh), and I could go on, but you get the point.
author: Jason L.

description: This place is such a disappointment. It used to be good but the food quality has slowly deteriorated. Ever since they moved the sauces behind the counter the place has been crap. Its still edible and the prices are ok, so it gets a second star. Actually, now that I think about it, the only thing I ever liked there was the chicken katsu. Don't go to Ono Hawaiian BBQ. They are basards.
author: Evan B.

description: I would give them a 5 but the service isn't always up to par. Their small servings are decently priced and give you a good amount of food. Their regular sized portions usually have enough to fill up on 2 separate occasions.
author: Geoff P.

description: Coming from So Cal i've only tasted one Spam Musubi place and that was at L&L I have to admit Ono's Spam Musubi is  better then L&L not A LOT BETTER but it was better it had more sauce on it but it kinda had too much rice. Overall a good place but they take a while to make food.
author: Jonathan L.

description: i LOVE this hawaiin bbq place the best! because its right next to stonestown, and afterwards i can go to nubi and get some fro yo for less than $1!  because the Ono receipt gives yu 30% off. i always order SPAM MUSUBI, chicken katsu with curry sauce, or bbq beef. mmm i want NOW x3
author: Kirstie P.

description: The Food was good, but I get scoops of rice the size of golf balls sometimes.  There is no quality control here.
author: Bobby L.

description: What to eat?  What to eat?  Stopped here one evenig to pickup Hawaiian food; teriyaki chicken and barbque chicken which comes with a scoop of rice and macaroni salad.  Both orders were just okay as I have had better.
author: Nanette L.

description:
We always order the family meal deal.. Chicken Katsu, BBQ chicken, and Teri beef and of course the side of mac and rice. 

Also you got to grab a few Spam or BBQ chicken musubi's to go. They are good cold or hot. 

We took a bunch of musubi's to a baby shower pot luck and it was the only thing the people were eating.
author: MysticZ T.

description:
good hawaiian - simple. clean and fast.
Jk (see below) of course did not like it - she writes some real stupid reviews - no wonder she's ugly with lot's of pimples!!!
get laid you big cow.
author: Rou V.

description:
Not bad...

Good Food...Cheap....and for me, Just right around the corner.  

To me, its the same as Hawaiian Drive and L&L....I can't taste the difference.
author: R. F.

description:
STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE BEFORE TAKING A TEST! While studying before a test my buddy and I decided to go to Ono's before class. Big mistake... i was so tired and gasy during the test, i couldn't focus on solutions and equations during my math test which resulted in a C and ruined my overall grade. Dont you hate it when you get those cold sweats trying not to fart in a classroom trying to take a test. 

Sidenote, my friend always orders the loco moco and he always notices the chefs laughing when its being ordered. Plus how can they have burger on the menu when you cant even order fries with it?!?!! OUTRAGEOUS I TELL YOU!  

I love this place, but this is definitely not study food.
author: Eric N.

description: When it first opened, I thought this would be an improvement on the other offerings in the city.  With the advent of several other chains and Hukilau, the competition is pretty fierce for authentic Hawaiian food.  The menu doesn't exactly exude Hawaiian other than the barbecue meats, macaroni salad, rice plates and the spam musubi; it's actually more of a fast food version of Korean barbecue, cross westernized Japanese food (katsu and teriyaki), and noodles.  The portions are generous as I ordered a chicken combo plate to go ($8.13) which comprised of barbecued marinated chicken (tasty with sweet flavor) and chicken katsu (breaded and fried with sweet katsu sauce on the side) on a bed of cooked cabbage (normally raw in Hawaii), a large scoop of rice and a scoop of macaroni salad.  It was very filling as I was already full after eating about 2/3rd of the plate.  They used to have a self serve sauce station, but they now give the prepacked sauces with your order.  A good point is that they do serve the food warm, unlike many fast food places who leave them under heat lamps (pre-cooked).  Can't wait to make my trip to Oahu to get the real island flavors.
author: Mike C.

description: This place is like any other Hawaiian place! I loooooooove BBQ chicken! But normally at these Hawaiian food places they overload on mayonnaise on the mac salad! I hate that!!
author: Janet Z.

description: If you're hungry for Hawaiian BBQ and you need a quick bite to eat, grab the mini meals. They come with two scoops of rice, macaroni salad and entrée of your choice: BBQ chicken (is a classic), BBQ beef, Chicken Katsu and others. And ooo god, get some spam musubi for later, or now.
author: Caryl C.

description: Yummy, yummy!  I love pork, and this place will give me lots of it.  It's cheaper than most Hawaiian restaurants, although it's got a limited and boring selection of foods...fried shrimp, teriyaki "island" chicken, Kalua pork, breaded and fried mahi.  I love those Hawaiian drinks that come in a can, too.  It's really busy, though, so call ahead and take out, if you don't like waiting.  Waaay better than scary L&L, but that's just my opinion, of course.
author: Kristina R.
