description: Fish should not taste like chicken - in fact, the fish taste/smell should overpower the chicken. Not only do I hate warm tartar sauce packets and questionable macaroni salad, but I don't like wondering if perhaps my mahi mahi actually had wings.
author: Courtney S.

description: Lately the chicken has been a little salty for me.  Don't know if it's my taste buds changing or them.   But this is still a tried and true go to as a fast food alternative.
author: Denise B.

description: The chicken katsu and spam masubi are pretty good. If you are conscious about eating healthy oh please don't come here and go somewhere else because the food is really fatty! The short ribs are pretty good too and if your not to hungry you can get a mini meal! Parking is easy and prices are okay!
author: Heather C.

description: Ono? Oh yes! Ono is cheap, fast and tasty with unbelievably large portions. They also have a killer macaroni salad, which doesn't come out of a plastic tub or milk carton - so mayolicious.
author: Donna A.

description: We usually like this place, but don't know why lately their food is not as good as use to be.  Maybe their new salad menu?  Please don't try any of their salad, pineapple chopped salad is salty!  Don't know why they put salt before dressing plus their salad is like your store brought Dole toss green bag salad and put some protein on it.  Nothing special at all, not taste good.  Their macaroni salad still good.  I don't think I will go there as often as I use to be.  Sorry!
author: Kitty G.

description: I like it.  Don't love it, but always seems to hit the spot when I'm having my rice cravings.  Prices are okay, but overall a pretty decent "fast foodish" place to get a inexpensive and quick meal.
author: Priscilla N.

description: The service was friendly, but it did take longer for my food to come out of the kitchen that I expected. The value was above average. This isn't the kind of place that one expects ambiance from, so I do not hold that against fast-food options. The place was clean, though. The food overall tasted above average. I would rate the menu below average.
author: Greg B.

description: I'm a fan of fried food but after eating here, I'm seriously reconsidering ever eating anything fried again (fried Snickers bar not withstanding). Maybe I'm just not a Hawaiian BBQ kinda gal.
author: Nathalie L.

description:
This place used to be a lot better when it first opened. Their portions have gotten smaller throughout the years and the food quality has also diminished with the entree size.

I used to go to Ono for lunch when it first opened, after a few years of college I went back to this small restaurant and everything is different. It's very stuffy inside, I often leave with the smokey scent on my clothes and it would not leave until after I shower and change.

The service is okay. I don't like how I have to ask for sauce, napkins, and utensils. It used to be on the counter next to the soda machine. It's just very troublesome having to ask for everything.

I ordered their mini curry chicken katsu and it's not as good as before. They changed their curry recipe, it tastes very watered down unsatisfying. 

Overall, I think they made way too many changes to the place and it's not what it used to be.
author: Wenting L.

description: I don't remember the name of the dish I chose but it was really good.  Hot, fresh, and tasty.  The cost of the meal for the amount I got was average.  I took one star off because I had to wait more than desired, but at least I didn't have to pay for or find parking.
author: Ian F.

description: the food is great, i really enjoy the bbq chicken and its good, :) so thats my favorite the food is fast and the staff is friendly
author: Alvin B.

description: Tasty Hawaiian bbq, ample portions, borderline pricey, about $9.75 for a meal with drink, decent customer service. All would've been good but they had a sign that said $5 value meal w/drink, when I walk in and try to order it, they say it's only mon-thurs. So now I have to dish out double that because I can't just walk out and look like a cheapo. I look at the sale sign again and do not see indication that the deal was only for mon-thurs, must have been in the 12 times roman size fine print.
author: Keit K.

description: I rarely eat there, but sometimes I crave for cheap yet good short ribs. And it's close to home, and the store is quite clean. The portions are decent, usually a mini gets me quite full.  But I don't really like their rice, one time it tasted like it wasn't  fully cooked, it was kinda hard.
author: Tadaa T.

description: This is so not food from the Islands since I know Hawaiian food when I see it. This is an ok place to go only if you want imitation Hawaiian food. The location is convenient for me but I rather drive to Daly City to go get Hawaiian food.
author: Maile W.

description:
I tried it out alone, then again because i really liked it.
My family all agree that it is good quality food for good price.

It is very very quick too, so if you are in hurry, stop by here.
They don't have much of a service.. atmosphere is something like McD.
author: Stephanie O.

description:
once upon a time when i was studying for CFA exams i used to study my ass off, grab a late mediocre quality dinner at ono, and then study some more.  then one day they changed ownership and not only did the quality of meats drop like britney's career when she married k-fed, but they decided to close earlier too!  useless.  oh, did i mention they raised the prices as well?  absolutely useless.  so i stopped eating there for a year.

fast forward to tonight: i happened to be at kinko's tonight and had not gotten a chance to eat dinner yet so i decided to give them another go 'round.  same crappy fatty chicken and mystery meat.   ono? try ohHELLno.
author: Steven C.

description: Someone got me some take-out from here just yesterday . I've never been a big fan of Hawaiian food but I must admit , the food was pretty darn decent . I will probably try some more food here again some time . =]
author: Eileen L.

description: My friends and I used to come here everyday . It's too bad that the price raised -___-" It's still good though . If you don't eat the vegetables, just replace it with rice or the macaronni salad (: Preetty good . The BBQ beef is so good ! It's best if you call in before to order if you want to pick up .
author: Jenny Y.

description: It's alright, not too many choices. Once you go in, you're going to leave with the smell, for sure. Service isn't really that fast, it takes a long time for them to give you the food. But this is the nearest Hawaiian BBQ place in the city to me, so I sometimes come. Otherwise, I really don't recommend this place, seems like there's a lot of MSG!
author: Vivian L.

description: their grease level compared to others (L&L and Hawaiian drive inn), are a lot more greaser. I rather go across to king of thai, which seems to be empty every time I walk by. Unless you can ask them to use lesser grease when they fry them up.
author: Robin L.

description: Typical hawaiian plate lunch.  I didn't really care for it when I lived in Hawaii, but I do like the kalua pork (with two scoop rice and one scoop macaroni) and spam musubi at Ono Hawaiian.  Haven't tried anything else there.
author: Curtis H.

description: I've only been here a few times and it is alright. It's a good choice if you are craving fast food Hawaiian food. The only issue is that they are not very fast at all in getting your order to you. The food is just OK, nothing special. I would recommend the $5 combo meal which they offer on Mondays through Thursdays. The lemon pepper chicken which is on their lighter menu is pretty good too. I would be back if I were in the neighborhood but I will not make a special trip to go there again.
author: Lisa M.

description: I don't know that it is more expensive like Ryan says, but I've had meals with the same taste for more expensive. Compared to L&L sure, it's slightly pricier, but is L&L situated next to a Gamestop, Albertson's, and PetCo? I think not!
author: Michael C.

description:
UPDATE:  It never fails.  This is the SLOWEST food place ever.  Every single time I order something, whether a big order or small, lots of people or only me, it seems to take 20 minutes for me to wait?!  That's not acceptable.  Especially when all I order is a masubi. just one.  It's not just me, I notice other people complain too because they order like one plate and it takes half an hour.  
The food is alright.  Compared to other hawaiian bbq places you can go to within a 10 minute distance, the food here is not anything special and the prices seem to be a bit much.  Even weirder is that in order to see the menu, you have to crouch down, literally squat on the ground to see it because it's hiding behind a wall divide.  You have to do this unless you're standing right in front of the register then you can see the menu just standing up and honestly, if you wait til then to take a look at the menu, the 10 people standing behind you creating a mess of a line out the door will get mad.  Another thing is that the food takes way to long to come out.  They have a really convenient location though and I LOVE their Spam and Chicken Teriyaki Masubi.  I dont know what it is about the sauce they use but MMmMmMm....
author: Jennifer N.

description: You and Hawaiian Drive Inn always makes me sick every single time. I don't know why. What do you put in your food!!?! I always end up getting a stomach ache. .. maybe the macaroni salad? I don't know... maybe I'm just Hawaiian-bbq-intolerant.
author: Allyson L.

description: ahh one lunch place I am glad I don't have to eat at anymore.  It's ok if you need your hawaiian food fix but seriously nothing to really rave about.  They got a bunch of high school kids serving you up and it's like a burger king but hawaii food style.  If you NEED hawaiian food and you are too lazy to drive out to the mission or Daly City for it then this will ok.
author: Allan T.

description:
OMG!  Love Ono!  My favorites are the Crab Langoon and BBQ Mix.  I eat here at least once a week on the day that my diet allows me to pig out.  I always phone in a "to-go" order since there is often a line of people waiting.  The BBQ is on the greasy side but after I have been depriving myself all week, this is major comfort food, plus the portions are large enough that I have usually have something left over for lunch the next day.

The gals at the counter are always really friendly and up beat and parking is pretty easy excpet maybe for Friday nights when the Blockbuster Video customers fill up the lot.
author: Adam Z.

description: I went here for lunch and this  place was okay very large portions I even left with some chicken which I gave to my doggie she liked it....
author: Kim R.

description: This is weird the food kinda made me sick which was not good. I mean its ok for people on the run but the food really tasted weird. It didn't taste fresh and there wasn't much flavor. The cashier was being rude to my friend with his kids which wasn't nice since they were behaving. I definitely want to try a different place for Hawaiian BBQ.
author: Nadia N.

description: I like this place so much more than L&L. The little things make the difference to me. The katsu sauce here is tastier than other Hawaiian fast food places as well the kalbi tastes better to me too. The crab langoon which is their take on what I usually see called rangoon is tasty too. The GF really likes the seafood saimin here too.
author: Johnny J.

description:
This place is disgusting!!
I ordered a bbq beef mini meal for lunch today. And after i ate half of it I found a metal wire (from one of those metal scrubs use for dish washing) in my food!! The manager didn't look like he gave a crap when I told him also. He just offered me a refund.
Worst hawaiian bbq. I will never go back to this place again.
author: kevin w.

description: Went to a potluck party and the teri beef and chicken were take-out from Ono's... and they were, well, ono. I give the dishes four stars for taste, but since I nevah wen buy um, I dunno how much dey wen cost, so I give dese buggahs tree stars fo' now.
author: Keith K.

description: You do get a lot of food for the money, so you can call that a value. The place is clean and the service is quick. But, not very "ono." I had the kalbi and my friend had the shirmp and chicken. Both plate lunches were too greasy. If some one paid for my next lunch there, I'd eat, but I'd rather not spend my own money there.
author: Coco K.

description: Maybe because I don't eat Hawaiian enough, but I don't see anything unique (tastefully) about this place. This is recommended by a disclosed friend(namely RD), and I am disappointed. I hope the next Hawaiian place I try will be to my satisfaction.
author: Martin L.

description: For anyone looking for a Hawaiian plate lunch, you should be able to get your fix here!  Seems to be in a random location, but it works for me!  I heard an L&L is on its way to downtown SF...
author: Joyce L.

description: So far, the best place I've found in SF to get a plate lunch.  Beats L&L Hawaiian Barbeque by a landslide.  I love the mac salad here....tastes almost as good as mine!
author: Lisa C.

description: (3.5 Stars) Ono is pretty ono for a quick, cheap meal.  The BBQ chicken is usually not too salty, and the Chicken Katsu is crispy and not too fatty.  The Kalbi ribs are a little fatty and tough for me, but that is not too surprising.  For those who like macaroni salad, this version has just the right amount of mayonaise.  Suprisingly, the rice is just right here.  Overall, better than L & L, for much less than it costs for a ticket to the Aloha State.
author: Kapeli M.

description:
some of the better chicken teriyaki i've had, and i usually prefer beef or short ribs; chicken katsu is just okay - nothing special, nothing bad either.  i prefer japanese katsu sauce (darker, thicker & spicier) vs. hawaiian katsu sauce (lighter, more watery & sweeter).  hubby regularly orders the moco loco.  

parking in the lot can be a challenge.  i'll have to check out the colma location...
author: Jen P.

description: I take food out from this place at least once a week. Their mini meals are an understatement - I can squeeze at least two meals out of one unless I'm so hungry I want to punch someone in the throat! The chicken terriyaki is really good, so is the crispy shrimp, chicken katsu and island curry! I just had the hamburger steak and it reminded me of salisbury steak. Yeah I don't do the macaroni salad - it's good the first bite but a big disaterous mistake if you eat the whole thing. Say no to it and just get more rice!
author: Alexis D.

description: Pretty mayonaisy mac salad from the L&L of socal.... eating here feels like Pleasanton.
author: Eugene G.

description: Of the bay area plate lunch places, I definitely favor Ono Hawaiian Grill.  My favorite dishes are the Maui Pineapple Chicken and their version of the caesar salad. They give so much food, it can last for days! The drawbacks are definitely the parking situation (you might try street parking on Sloat Blvd. as an alternative) and the wait. Once the lines get going, the wait can get to you.
author: chip n. c.

description: Sorry cousin, it's more like "Oh No!" Hawaiian Grill. You can go to Hawaiian Drive Inn or L&L for much less $$$! Portions and taste are not much different than other Hawaiian joints, but food to go shouldn't have to be more than $7 a person! And parking is just too tight. But I guess if you're in the area, it's better than nothing.
author: Leroid D.

description: Do you want something quick, tasty and filling?  Do you want beef and chicken?!  Come to Ono Hawaiian and you'll be in heaven.  The food there is cheap, consistently good and fast.  It's like a fast food take out restaurant that's always yummy.  Give it a try, you know you want to!
author: Manton R.

description: Food is hit or miss.  I really like the main dish, but the side dishes are weak.  The rice is okay, but the macaroni salad thingy is very bland, cold, and lacking.  Would be more stars if they stepped up on their side dishes and added some other yummy choices.
author: Mary R.

description: I love their spam Mousbi.... juss seaweed wrap with rice and  spam and teriyaki sauce.... just $3.09 that makes me fuLL... you can dine in or out and take out!!!!!!!!
author: Lily T.

description: Their regular meals can be alittle expensive, so there is a trick!!! order their mini meal and the portions of meat is exactly the same as a regular. Only difference you get alittle bit less rice and macroni.
author: David M.

description: I blame this place for my weight problem! lol So Hawaiian plates consist of rice extra rich mayo macroni salad and some sort of protein...chicke, beef, short ribs, mahi mahi deep fried or deep fried shrimp. Oh don't forget the spam musibi and crab lagoon. Anywas not the best every but its quick and its a lot and affordable and its pretty good.
author: Hyung L.

description: Huge portions! last time we bought two orders of the chicken,shrimp and fish ( i think it was called the seafood special or something...)  and it fed 4 people.. not very hungry people.. the food was alright? alittle greasy and it gave me a food coma after.but its cheap and it kept us full until dinner.
author: christy w.

description: If you're patient  and willing to experiment, I think that you may eventually find something here that's not too nasty.  It hasn't quite worked out that way for me yet but I keep trying because I'm irresistably drawn to the call of the islands, hula music, and fond memories of a little blue fuzzy alien in a grass skirt.
author: David H.

description: 3rd luncheon for the month of July = high blood pressure 155/99 :(  the wedding couple brought us a sumptuous luncheon from Ono, I was wearing my Hawaiian shirt, I was supposed to wear an animal print as requested by the Big Boss, but she'll never make me, I'm the problem one in the office :)  I ate all the 3 choices, ribs, chicken, and beef,  seasoning was perfect, not too salty and the hint of sugar made me come back for a 2nd plate.
author: sfbutterfly l.

description: You definitely get your money's worth of meat and food at this place!  It is our favorite place to get take out Hawaiian food in the city.  You can eat there like fast food style too but usually the swarm of loud high school and college students discourage us.  We usually order the spam masubi (2 LARGE rolls for $2.50!) and the BBQ Beef Mini meal ($4.09!) and trust me, they give you plenty for 1 person!  What a bargain!  Call ahead and order if you want take out since the wait can be long.
author: SFFoodie F.

description: Im going to be nice and give this 2 stars.  This place has screwed up my order a few times and yes its my fault for not checking but unwrapping all the food we ordered before walking out is a huge hassle and we shouldn't have to do it.  I've had curry katsu with no curry and similiar things like that.  I am not a food snob and yes I know what to expect when going to fast food places.  I gave L & L 4 stars but ono is lucky to get 2.  Their spam masubis are ok (yes there is better ways to cook spam)...  and there service for a fast food place varies too much.   Sometimes its ok but sometimes it would have been faster to go eat at king of thai across the parking lot.
author: Jae L.

description: I come here time to time mainly because of the location.  If I didn't feel like any of the other food places on Lakeshore Plaza, I'd pick this.  I've had the BBQ Chicken and Pineapple Chicken?  The BBQ Chicken isn't that great, it COULD be better.  Though I like their pineapple sauce, the chicken is still the same BBQ Chicken.  I actually do like their macaroni salad that comes with the meals, but you can only have so much of it.  The place is very very clean since someone is constantly cleaning.  Another downside is that it may take a while to get your food.  But kudos for them for carrying those nectar drinks!  "Pass-O-Guava"!
author: deeks ..

description: i like their kalbi. tender, fatty, sweet and meaty. their crab langoon is also worth buying if you like fried food and cream cheese. their family meal is also a great deal. you get 3 or 4 entrees, rice and mac salad for around $20. not bad!
author: Tin-Tin E.

description: I had horrible service here.  I recently catered from Ono's.  I pre-ordered my order days in advance.  They had enough time.  I went to pick it up and when I gave them in receipt, it seemed like they didn't know about my order.  All I got was "they're cooking it now"... but in reality, they forgot about my order and just started it.  They made me wait and the party was delayed because of their poor customer service.  I asked to talk to a manager and they said he wasn't there.  That's fine.  I gave them my phone number and asked that the manager call me.  Guess what.  No phone call.  I have to give them 1 star for their customer service.
author: cow d.

description: It's a bit more pricier than Hawaiian Drive Inn and L&L and it can get a bit crowded just like the other Hawaiian food joints that hint, by the scarcity of tables, that they would rather have you take-out than dine-in.  The food is good and I really can't taste the difference.  The restaurant is new and furniture and decor is of modern contemporary design.  The parking situation there sucks like a Dyson vacuum cleaner.  Make sure you have insurance in case someone bumps into your car.
author: Raging R.

description:
I don't know anything about hawaiian cuisine.
This place is in the strip mall by my place. There's always parking in the lot right in front. The portions are huge, I'm a big eater and I always get the mini meal ($5) and it fills me up. The macaroni salad is always good, if a little underseasoned. The rice is always good, never to wet or too dry, never undercooked. The grilled chicken is good, though the fat doesn't always cook off completely. The beef is quite salty, fine for me but I'm surprised others don't complain more. I've tried their fried stuff too, sometimes it's a bit dry, but you have their delicious warm teriyaki sauce to fix that. between the teriyaki sauce, katsu sauce, vietnamese rooster hot sauce, soy sauce, and hot mustard, you can add flavor in the direction and quantity as you see fit.
Only reason they don't get five stars is that the shortribs are really fatty (inedibly so) and the wait time is inconsistent (sometimes under 5 min, sometimes over 10). You can call ahead, but most don't.
author: Matt G.

description: if you are on a diet, trust me you do not want to come here. i would say they have really good bbq dishes. my fave is the bbq short ribs (#7) and the ono burger. it really hits the spot with the nice marinated, fatty ribs. they give you three slabs with a scoop of mac salad and a scoop of rice. i prefer soy sauce on my rice and salad, what asian doesn't like that combo? the burger is big and greasy. it beats out the ones you get at burger king or any fast food joint. the prices is a little much but what other hawaiian bbq place doesn't over charge you. i rather come here than any other places cuz the quality is great.
author: Lynn P.

description: I only do take-out.  I've tried all the chicken dishes and the BBQ is my favorite.  The chicken tonight was overcooked, but still tasty.  I might consider catering the BBQ chicken from here if I have a big party.
author: D C.

description:
its a cool place friendly and food is good
there is also a game stop when ur waiting
author: matt y.

description: It's a tad expensive, especially if you like to get something to drink with your food. But, who gets something to drink with their food these days? Okay, I admit, I do! The food is great though. So far I've had the mixed sea food combo and the Haiwaiian BBQ Mix and I've been more than just satisfied with both. The sea food seemed fresh, and the meat was quite tender, but not too tender. The crowd there, sometimes at least, is very hip. So hip that I'd rather avoid it, but the place keeps me coming back for more. Another positive factor is that you can sit outside, sure you can do that in many places, but here you can do it while it rains too. Yes, you read me correctly, while it rains. Isn't that awesome? I think it's quite cool. I haven't ever seen anyone sit outside while it rained, nor have I ever been in that neighborhood during a rainstorm. Does that mean it never rains there? No, it doesn't. But it means, by my disturbingly illogical logic, that it's a great place to eat.
author: Roger W.

description: My gf and I had the Kalbi short ribs and the spam musubi.  Sooo good.  And all for $16.  I love this place.
author: Brian L.

description: Taking into consideration the taste of teriyaki BBQ I was raised with (mom born and raised in Honolulu), I have found the San Francisco location to have a taste pretty close to what I was raised with.  Therefore, I find this location to have the best tasting Hawaiian food, and their Mac is good too.  How the food is perceived depends upon what one is used to eating.  And I think nationality plays a very big part.  When I was last in the Islands, we met some Hawaiian guy in Hana that was BBQ'ing in his front yard to make money for family vacation.  His taste was identical to what I'm used to and most enjoy.  Food  at Ono Hawaiian BQ is ONO!!!!!  (Hawaiian for good)
author: Dee W.
